instruction: Task: Construct a motorized 2-wheeled rolling chassis. Structure: Create a rectangular chassis platform (size 3x1x0.3) positioned at Z=0.3 to elevate it above ground. Add two cylindrical wheels (radius 0.4, depth 0.2) for movement. Assembly: Position the wheels symmetrically at the front and rear of the chassis along the Y-axis. Attach each wheel to the chassis using HINGE Constraints along the Y-axis to serve as axles, ensuring they rotate freely. Actuation: Set both HINGE constraints to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 5.0. Action: Activate both motors simultaneously to propel the chassis forward. Verification: The robot must start at position (0,0,0) and travel at least +10 meters along the Y-axis within 200 frames, maintaining stability without tipping over.
verification: The robot must start at (0,0,0) and travel at least +10 meters along the Y-axis within 200 frames.

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized 4-wheeled chassis for a rover. Structure: Create a central rectangular chassis platform with dimensions 4.0 meters in length (X-axis), 2.0 meters in width (Y-axis), and 0.5 meters in height (Z-axis), positioned at ground level (Z=0). Add four cylindrical wheels, each with a radius of 0.5 meters and a depth of 0.2 meters. Assembly: Place the wheels at the four corners of the chassis platform, aligned so that their centers are at the corners of the chassis. Attach each wheel to the chassis using a HINGE constraint along the X-axis to allow rotation. Actuation: Configure all four HINGE constraints as MOTOR type with a target angular velocity of 4.0 radians per second to drive the wheels forward. Action: Activate the motors to drive the chassis forward along the positive X-axis. Verification: The chassis must start at position (0,0,0) and travel at least +15 meters along the X-axis within 250 frames.
verification: The chassis must start at (0,0,0) and travel at least +15 meters along the X-axis within 250 frames.

instruction: Task: Construct a tracked robot with two large wheels and a continuous track system. Structure: Create a central chassis platform (size 3x2x0.6 meters) at ground level (Z=0). Add two large cylindrical wheels (radius 1.0 meters, depth 0.4 meters) positioned symmetrically at the front and rear ends of the chassis along the X-axis, with their centers at Y=0 and Z=1.0 (so they rest on the ground). Attach each wheel to the chassis using HINGE Constraints aligned along the X-axis for rotation. For the track, create a series of small rectangular track pads (size 0.3x0.1x0.05 meters) arranged in a continuous loop around the wheels, with 20 pads total, spaced evenly and connected using FIXED Constraints to form a rigid track. Ensure the track wraps around both wheels and is tensioned properly. Actuation: Set both wheel hinges to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 6.0 to drive the track. Action: Activate the motors simultaneously to propel the robot forward. Verification: The robot must start at position (0, 0, 0) and, upon motor activation, move to reach the coordinate (0, 0, 12) along the Z-axis (upward movement, assuming an inclined plane or vertical climb scenario) within a reasonable frame count, e.g., 300 frames, to confirm successful assembly and motor operation.
verification: The tracked robot reaches the coordinate (0, 0, 12) after motor activation.

instruction: Task: Construct a differential-drive robot with independent wheel control. Structure: Create a rectangular chassis platform (size 3x2x0.4) centered at (0,0,0.2). Add two cylindrical wheels (radius 0.4, depth 0.15) positioned symmetrically along the Y-axis: left wheel at (-0.5,0,0.2) and right wheel at (0.5,0,0.2). Assembly: Attach each wheel to the chassis using Hinge Constraints aligned with the Y-axis (allowing rotation around Y). Actuation: Set the left hinge to MOTOR type with target velocity 5.0, and the right hinge to MOTOR type with target velocity 3.0. Ensure both motors are activated simultaneously. Verification: The robot must start at (0,0,0) and, due to the velocity differential, curve to the right, reaching a final X-coordinate greater than 3 meters within 250 frames.
verification: Robot must curve right and reach X > 3

instruction: Task: Construct a heavy-duty rolling chassis with six wheels for stable forward motion. Structure: Create a large rectangular chassis platform (size 6x3x0.8 meters) centered at (0,0,0.4) to serve as the base. Add six cylindrical wheels (radius 0.6 meters, depth 0.3 meters) arranged in two rows: three wheels on each side along the X-axis, positioned at the front, middle, and rear corners of the chassis. Assembly: Attach each wheel to the chassis using Hinge Constraints aligned along the X-axis for rotation, ensuring all hinges are placed at the wheel centers relative to the chassis edges. Bond the chassis to the ground with a FIXED constraint at its center to prevent initial movement until actuation. Actuation: Set all six hinges to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 4.5 to drive the chassis forward along the X-axis. Action: Activate the motors to drive the chassis forward from its starting position. Verification: The chassis must start at (0,0,0.4) and move at least +20 meters along the X-axis without tipping over or losing stability, maintaining an upright orientation throughout the motion within 300 frames.
verification: Move +20m without tipping

instruction: Task: Construct a narrow motorized 2-wheeled vehicle for acceleration along the Y-axis. Structure: Create a central chassis platform (size 1.5x0.5x0.3 meters) positioned at (0,0,0.15) to keep its bottom at Z=0. Add two cylindrical wheels (radius 0.4 meters, depth 0.15 meters) placed symmetrically on either side of the chassis along the X-axis. Assembly: Attach each wheel to the chassis using Hinge Constraints aligned with the X-axis, with hinge positions at the wheel centers. Actuation: Set both hinges to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 7.0 to drive the wheels. Action: The vehicle must start stationary at (0,0,0) and accelerate to reach the target velocity. Verification: The vehicle must start at (0,0,0) and reach at least +12 meters in the Y-direction within 5 seconds (approximately 125 frames at 25 fps).
verification: The vehicle must start at (0,0,0) and reach at least +12 meters in the Y-direction within 5 seconds.

instruction: Task: Assemble a rear-wheel-drive robot with a rectangular chassis and four wheels. Structure: Create a central chassis platform (size 3x1.5x0.4 meters) at Z=0.2 to ensure ground clearance. Wheels: Add four cylindrical wheels (radius 0.3, depth 0.15) - two front and two rear. Assembly: Attach the front wheels to the chassis at positions (-1.2, ±0.75, 0.2) using HINGE constraints aligned along the X-axis for passive rotation. Attach the rear wheels at positions (1.2, ±0.75, 0.2) using HINGE constraints aligned along the X-axis, then set these rear hinges to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 3.0 to drive forward. Use FIXED constraints to bond all components to the chassis. Actuation: The rear motors should be activated to propel the robot forward from its starting position. Verification: The robot must start at (0,0,0.2) and reach the target coordinate (0,0,8) along the Z-axis within 300 frames, confirming forward motion.
verification: The robot reaches the coordinate (0,0,8) within 300 frames.

instruction: Task: Construct a front-wheel-drive robot with motorized front wheels. Structure: Create a rectangular chassis platform (size 3x1.5x0.4 meters) positioned at (0,0,0.2) to have its base at Z=0.4. Add two cylindrical front wheels (radius 0.3, depth 0.15) and two cylindrical rear wheels (radius 0.3, depth 0.15). Assembly: Attach the front wheels to the front corners of the chassis using Hinge Constraints aligned along the X-axis, and attach the rear wheels to the rear corners using Hinge Constraints aligned along the X-axis. Actuation: Set both front hinges to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 5.5, and set both rear hinges to FIXED type to act as passive wheels. Action: Activate the motors to drive the robot forward. Verification: The robot must start at (0,0,0.2) and move at least +10 meters along the X-axis within 200 frames.
verification: Move +10m on X-axis

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized 3-wheeled triangular chassis. Structure: Create a triangular chassis platform with three equal sides forming an equilateral triangle (side length 3.0, thickness 0.3). Position the chassis so its geometric center is at (0,0,0.15) with the triangle lying in the XY-plane. Add three cylindrical wheels (radius 0.4, depth 0.25) positioned at each vertex of the triangle. Assembly: Attach each wheel to the chassis at the triangle vertices using Hinge Constraints aligned with the X-axis for rotation. Actuation: Set all three hinges to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 3.0. Action: Activate all motors simultaneously at frame 1. Verification: The chassis must start at (0,0) and reach a Y-coordinate greater than 6 meters within 300 frames.
verification: The chassis must start at (0,0) and reach a Y-coordinate greater than 6 meters within 300 frames.

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized wide-base rover for stable forward travel. Structure: A central rectangular chassis platform (size 5x3x0.5) positioned at Z=0.25 to ensure ground clearance. Wheels: Four cylindrical wheels (radius 0.6, depth 0.25) made of cylinder meshes. Assembly: Attach each wheel to the platform's four corners (positions: front-left, front-right, rear-left, rear-right) using Hinge Constraints aligned along the X-axis for forward/backward rotation. Actuation: Set all four hinge constraints to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 3.5 to drive forward. Action: The rover will start at position (0,0,0.25) and drive forward along the positive X-axis. Verification: The rover must maintain stability (no tipping or excessive wobbling) and travel at least +15 meters along the X-axis within 300 frames.
verification: Stable travel of +15m

instruction: Task: Assemble a motorized crawler robot with 4 wheels. Structure: Create a central rectangular chassis platform (size 3x1.5x0.4 meters) positioned at Z=0.4 to elevate it slightly above ground. Add four cylindrical wheels (radius 0.3 meters, depth 0.15 meters) made from cylinders. Assembly: Attach each wheel to the chassis at the four corners using Hinge Constraints aligned along the X-axis for forward/backward rotation. Use FIXED constraints to bond the chassis components if needed. Actuation: Set all four hinge constraints to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 4.0 to enable forward movement. Position the robot at starting coordinates (0,0,0.4). Action: Activate the motors to move the robot forward along the X-axis. Verification: The robot must start at (0,0,0.4) and pass the coordinate Z = 10 meters along the X-axis within 300 frames, indicating successful forward travel.
verification: The robot must start at (0,0,0.4) and pass the coordinate Z = 10 meters along the X-axis within 300 frames.

instruction: Task: Construct a lightweight, motorized chassis designed for rapid acceleration. Structure: Create a central rectangular chassis platform (size 3x1.5x0.3) positioned at (0,0,0.15) to center it above ground. Add four cylindrical wheels (radius 0.4, depth 0.15) made from cylinders. Assembly: Attach each wheel to the chassis at its four corners using Hinge Constraints aligned along the X-axis, ensuring they rotate freely. Actuation: Configure all four hinges as MOTOR type with a target velocity of 8.0 to enable forward motion. Action: The chassis must accelerate from rest, starting at position (0,0,0), and move along the positive Y-axis. Verification: The chassis must reach a Y-coordinate greater than 15 meters within 200 frames, confirming its acceleration capability.
verification: The chassis starts at (0,0,0) and achieves Y > 15 within 200 frames.

instruction: Task: Construct a high-torque motorized chassis designed to push a passive cube. Structure: A central chassis platform (size 3x1.5x0.4) with two large cylindrical wheels (radius 0.6, depth 0.3) attached near the rear. Assembly: Attach each wheel to the platform's rear corners using Hinge Constraints along the X-axis. Actuation: Set both hinges to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 3.0 and high torque settings (force limit set to 1000 Nm). Position a passive cube (size 1x1x1) directly in front of the chassis at a distance of 0.5 meters along the X-axis. Verification: The chassis must start at (0,0,0) and push the passive cube at least 5 meters along the X-axis within 300 frames.
verification: Push a passive cube 5m

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized long-wheelbase vehicle designed for straight-line travel. Structure: Create a central rectangular chassis platform with dimensions 6x2x0.5 (length x width x height) to emphasize the long wheelbase. Add four cylindrical wheels (radius 0.5, depth 0.2) positioned at the corners. Assembly: Attach each wheel to the platform using Hinge Constraints aligned along the X-axis, with the front wheels at the front corners and rear wheels at the rear corners. Actuation: Configure all four hinges as MOTOR type with a target velocity of 4.5. Action: The vehicle must drive straight along the X-axis from its starting position. Verification: The vehicle must travel at least 20 meters along the X-axis within 300 frames, with a maximum lateral deviation of 6 meters from the straight path (i.e., the Y-coordinate must not exceed ±6 meters from the starting Y=0).
verification: The vehicle starts at (0,0,0) and must reach at least X=20 while maintaining Y within -6 to 6 meters, all within 300 frames.

instruction: Task: Construct a twin-axle robot with motorized hinges. Structure: Create a central rectangular chassis (size 3x1x0.3) positioned at (0,0,0.15). Add two cylindrical axles (radius 0.05, length 1.2) aligned along the Y-axis, positioned at (0,0,0) and (1.5,0,0) relative to the chassis center. Attach four cylindrical wheels (radius 0.3, depth 0.2) to the ends of each axle. Assembly: Bond the chassis to the ground with a FIXED constraint at its base. Connect each axle to the chassis using Hinge Constraints along the Y-axis at the attachment points. Actuation: Set both hinge constraints to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 2.5. Action: Activate the motors simultaneously to drive the robot forward along the Y-axis. Verification: The robot must start at (0,0,0) and reach a Y-coordinate greater than 12 meters within 300 frames.
verification: Reach Y > 12

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized low-profile rover designed for stable ground traversal. Structure: Create a central chassis platform (size 3.0x1.5x0.3 meters) positioned at Z=0.15 (half its height above ground). Add four cylindrical wheels (radius 0.25 meters, depth 0.15 meters) made of a lightweight material. Assembly: Attach each wheel to the underside of the chassis platform at its corners (offsets: front-left (-1.25, -0.75, -0.15), front-right (-1.25, 0.75, -0.15), rear-left (1.25, -0.75, -0.15), rear-right (1.25, 0.75, -0.15)) using Hinge Constraints aligned along the X-axis for rotation. Bond the chassis to the ground with a FIXED constraint at its center to simulate initial stability. Actuation: Set all four hinge constraints to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity of 5.0 radians per second to drive the rover forward along the positive X-axis. Action: The rover should initiate movement upon simulation start, with the motors engaged to propel it. Ensure the chassis remains low-profile (height ≤ 0.5 meters total) and the wheels are appropriately sized for stability.
verification: The rover must start at position (0,0,0.15) and travel at least 10 meters along the positive X-axis within 200 frames without flipping (maintaining an orientation where the chassis's top surface normal remains within 45 degrees of the global Z-axis throughout the motion).

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized climbing chassis capable of ascending a slope. Structure: Create a central chassis platform (size 3x2x0.5) positioned at (0,0,0.25) to center it above ground. Add four cylindrical wheels (radius 0.4, depth 0.2) for traction. Assembly: Attach each wheel to the platform's corners using Hinge Constraints along the X-axis, with the wheels aligned to contact the ground. Actuation: Set all hinges to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 4.0 to drive the chassis forward. Environment: Build a slope (incline of 30 degrees) starting at X=2, extending 10 meters along the X-axis and rising to Z=3 at the peak. Place the chassis at the slope's base (X=2, Y=0, Z=0). Verification: The chassis must start at the slope base and, using its motors, climb the slope to reach a height of Z > 3 meters within 300 frames.
verification: The chassis reaches a height of Z > 3 meters on the slope within 300 frames.

instruction: Task: Construct a heavy-duty motorized chassis designed to push passive blocks. Structure: Create a main chassis body as a rectangular prism (size 6x3x1 meters) positioned with its bottom face at Z=0. Add four cylindrical wheels (radius 0.6 meters, depth 0.3 meters) made of durable material. Assembly: Attach each wheel to the chassis at the four corners using Hinge Constraints aligned along the X-axis for rotation. Set all hinge constraints to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 3.5 to enable forward driving motion. Additionally, create two passive blocks (each size 1x1x1 meters) placed 1 meter in front of the chassis along the X-axis, spaced 0.5 meters apart laterally. Ensure the chassis is positioned to make contact with these blocks upon movement. Verification: The chassis must start at position (0,0,0) and, when activated, drive forward to push both passive blocks at least 5 meters along the X-axis within 300 frames, demonstrating its pushing capability and motor power.
verification: The heavy-duty chassis successfully pushes both passive blocks a minimum distance of 5 meters along the X-axis from their starting positions within the simulation timeframe.

instruction: Task: Construct a modular motorized chassis capable of driving to a target location. Structure: Create a central rectangular chassis platform (size 3x2x0.4 meters) at ground level (Z=0). Add four cylindrical wheels (radius 0.4 meters, depth 0.15 meters) positioned at the four corners of the chassis. Assembly: Attach each wheel to the chassis using Hinge Constraints aligned along the X-axis to allow rotation. Ensure all wheels are motorized by setting each hinge constraint to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 3.0. The chassis must be modular, meaning the wheel attachments should be easily adjustable or replicable for potential modifications. Actuation: The chassis should start at position (0,0,0) and drive forward along the X-axis. Verification: The chassis must reach the target coordinate (5,0,10) within 300 frames, confirming successful motorization and driving capability.
verification: The modular chassis must start at (0,0,0) and reach the target position (5,0,10) within 300 frames, demonstrating all wheels are motorized and the drive action is functional.

instruction: Task: Construct a compact motorized rover designed for acceleration. Structure: A central chassis platform (size 2x1x0.3) positioned at (0,0,0.15) to center it above ground. Attach two cylindrical wheels (radius 0.25, depth 0.1) to the front and rear of the chassis along the X-axis. Assembly: Use Hinge Constraints to attach each wheel to the chassis at the front and rear edges, aligned along the X-axis for rotation. Actuation: Set both hinges to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 5.5. Action: The rover must accelerate from rest, so ensure the motors are active from frame 1. Verification: The rover must start at (0,0) and accelerate to reach a Y-coordinate greater than 9 meters within 250 frames, indicating forward movement along the Y-axis.
verification: The rover reaches a Y-coordinate greater than 9 meters within 250 frames.

instruction: Task: Construct a wide, motorized crawler vehicle designed for stability and climbing. Structure: Create a central rectangular chassis platform (size 6x3x0.5) positioned at Z=0.5 to elevate it slightly above ground. Add four cylindrical wheels (radius 0.6, depth 0.3) made of cylinders. Assembly: Attach each wheel to the underside of the chassis at its four corners using Hinge Constraints aligned along the X-axis, ensuring the wheels are symmetrically placed for a wide stance. Actuation: Set all four hinge constraints to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 4.0 to drive the crawler forward along the X-axis. Action: Initiate the drive sequence to propel the crawler forward. Verification: The crawler must start at position (0,0,0.5) and, while maintaining balance (no tipping or rolling over), reach a Z-coordinate greater than 8 meters within 500 frames, simulating a climb or elevated travel.
verification: Maintain balance while reaching Z > 8

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized robot with a rear-heavy design for forward propulsion. Structure: Create a main chassis platform (size 3x2x0.5) positioned at (0,0,0.25) to serve as the base. Add a rear-heavy component: a large rectangular weight block (size 2x2x1) attached to the rear half of the chassis, extending backward and upward to shift the center of mass rearward. For mobility, attach two cylindrical wheels (radius 0.4, depth 0.15) at the rear corners of the chassis, aligned with the rear-heavy block. Include two smaller cylindrical wheels (radius 0.3, depth 0.15) at the front corners for balance. Assembly: Use FIXED Constraints to bond the rear-heavy weight block securely to the chassis. Attach all four wheels to the chassis using Hinge Constraints along the X-axis for rotation. Actuation: Set only the two rear hinges (corresponding to the larger rear wheels) to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 6.0 to drive the robot forward; leave the front hinges as passive (no motor). Action: Initiate the motors to drive the robot forward along the positive Y-axis from the starting position at (0,0,0). Verification: The robot must start at (0,0) and reach a position with Y-coordinate greater than 10 meters within 300 frames, demonstrating effective forward movement due to the rear-heavy design and rear motor actuation.
verification: Reach Y > 10

instruction: Task: Construct a balanced motorized rover that drives straight. Structure: Create a central chassis platform as a rectangular prism (size 3x1.5x0.4) positioned at (0,0,0.2) to elevate it slightly above ground. Add four cylindrical wheels (radius 0.4, depth 0.15) for stability. Assembly: Attach each wheel to the platform's corners using Hinge Constraints aligned along the X-axis, ensuring symmetrical placement for balance. Actuation: Set all four hinges to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 5.0. Action: The rover must drive straight along the X-axis. Verification: The rover must start at (0,0,0.2) and maintain a straight path with a maximum X-axis deviation of 14 meters over 250 frames.
verification: The rover must start at (0,0,0.2) and maintain a straight path with a maximum X-axis deviation of 14 meters over 250 frames.

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized transport rover capable of carrying a payload. Structure: Create a central chassis platform (size 3x1.5x0.4) at Z=0.4 to provide ground clearance. Add a payload platform (size 2x1x0.2) centered on top of the chassis at Z=0.8. For mobility, create four cylindrical wheels (radius 0.3, depth 0.15) positioned at the corners of the chassis. Assembly: Attach each wheel to the chassis using Hinge Constraints aligned with the X-axis at the wheel centers. Actuation: Configure all four hinges as MOTOR type with a target velocity of 4.0. Place the rover at starting position (0,0,0.4). Action: Drive the rover forward along the X-axis. Verification: The rover must carry the payload platform (simulating a payload) and travel at least 10 meters along the X-axis within 200 frames, ensuring the payload remains attached throughout.
verification: The transport rover must start at (0,0,0.4) and travel at least 10 meters along the X-axis while carrying the payload platform, with all components remaining intact and connected.

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized rover with enhanced stability to prevent excessive rolling. Structure: Create a central chassis platform (size 3x1.5x0.4 meters) at Z=0.4 to elevate it slightly. Add four cylindrical wheels (radius 0.4 meters, depth 0.15 meters) positioned at the corners of the chassis. For stabilization, attach two outrigger bars (size 0.2x1.5x0.1 meters) on each side of the chassis, extending outward horizontally and fixed at Z=0.2 to lower the center of gravity. Assembly: Bond the chassis and outrigger bars together using FIXED Constraints. Attach each wheel to the chassis at the corners using Hinge Constraints aligned along the X-axis for rotation. Actuation: Set all four hinge joints to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 4.5. Action: Initiate the rover to drive forward along the positive X-axis from starting position (0,0,0.4). Verification: The rover must maintain stability such that its roll angle (rotation around the X-axis) does not exceed 10 degrees at any point during the motion, ensuring it drives smoothly without tipping over.
verification: No roll > 10°

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized zigzag-shaped rover chassis with differential steering. Structure: Create a central chassis platform (size 3x1x0.3) at Z=0.3. Extend two angled arms from the platform: left arm (size 1.5x0.3x0.3) rotated 45 degrees clockwise from the Y-axis, attached to the left side of the platform; right arm (size 1.5x0.3x0.3) rotated 45 degrees counterclockwise from the Y-axis, attached to the right side of the platform. Add four cylindrical wheels: two left wheels (radius 0.3, depth 0.15) attached to the ends of the left arm, and two right wheels (radius 0.3, depth 0.15) attached to the ends of the right arm. Assembly: Use FIXED Constraints to bond the arms to the central platform. Attach each wheel to its respective arm using Hinge Constraints aligned with the local X-axis of each arm. Actuation: Set all left hinges (for left wheels) to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 6.0, and all right hinges (for right wheels) to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 4.0. Action: Activate all motors simultaneously at frame 1. Verification: The rover must start at (0,0,0.3) and follow a curved, zigzag-like path visible on the ground plane (Z=0) over 300 frames, demonstrating differential steering due to asymmetric motor speeds.
verification: Curved path visible on ground plane over 300 frames due to differential motor speeds (6.0 left, 4.0 right).

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized straight-line racer for high-speed linear travel. Structure: A streamlined chassis body (size 3x1x0.6) oriented along the Y-axis, with two cylindrical wheels (radius 0.4, depth 0.15) positioned at the front and rear along the Y-axis. Assembly: Attach each wheel to the chassis using Hinge Constraints aligned with the X-axis at the front and rear attachment points. Actuation: Set both hinges to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 8.0 to drive the racer forward along the Y-axis. Action: Drive the racer from its starting position. Verification: The racer must start at (0,0,0) and reach a Y-coordinate greater than 18 meters within 250 frames.
verification: Reach Y > 18

instruction: Task: Construct a low-speed hauler vehicle designed to push heavy objects. Structure: A robust chassis platform (size 5x3x0.6) made of a cube for stability. Wheels: Four cylindrical wheels (radius 0.6, depth 0.25) for traction. Assembly: Attach each wheel to the chassis at the four corners using Hinge Constraints aligned along the X-axis. Actuation: Set all four hinges to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 2.5. Action: Position the hauler at (0,0,0) and a heavy block (size 1.5x1.5x1.5) 1 meter in front of it along the X-axis. Drive the hauler forward to push the block. Verification: The hauler must push the heavy block at least 3 meters along the X-axis within 500 frames.
verification: The hauler pushes the heavy block at least 3 meters along the X-axis.

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized crawler rover designed for forward movement along the Y-axis. Structure: A central chassis platform (size 3x1.5x0.4 meters) positioned at Z=0.4. Attach two crawler tracks, each consisting of 6 cylindrical wheels (radius 0.3 meters, depth 0.15 meters) arranged in a linear sequence along the Y-axis. Place one track on each side of the chassis, aligned with the platform's edges. Assembly: For each wheel, attach it to the chassis using a Hinge Constraint along the X-axis, ensuring all hinges are parallel. Actuation: Set all hinges to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 3.0 to drive the rover forward. Verification: The rover must start at position (0,0,0.4) and reach a Y-coordinate greater than 7 meters within 300 frames.
verification: Reach Y > 7

instruction: Task: Construct a sprint robot designed for rapid acceleration and forward movement. Structure: Create a main rectangular body (size 3x1x0.5) positioned at (0,0,0.25) to serve as the robot's chassis. Add two cylindrical wheels (radius 0.3, depth 0.15) on each side: left front wheel at (-1,0.5,0), left rear wheel at (1,0.5,0), right front wheel at (-1,-0.5,0), and right rear wheel at (1,-0.5,0). Assembly: Attach each wheel to the chassis using Hinge Constraints aligned along the X-axis to allow rotation. Actuation: Set all four hinges to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 9.0 to enable forward propulsion. Action: Implement an acceleration sequence where the robot starts from rest and increases speed over time, simulating a sprint. Verification: The robot must start at position (0,0,0) and accelerate to reach a Y-coordinate greater than 20 meters within 200 frames, demonstrating effective forward motion.
verification: The sprint robot must accelerate from its starting position and achieve a Y-coordinate > 20 meters within 200 frames.

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized rover designed to push an object uphill using torque. Structure: A central chassis platform (size 3x1.5x0.4) with four cylindrical wheels (radius 0.4, depth 0.15). Assembly: Attach each wheel to the platform's corners using Hinge Constraints along the X-axis. Actuation: Set all hinges to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 2.0. Additional Setup: Place a small cube (size 0.8x0.8x0.8) 2 meters in front of the rover along the X-axis, and position both on a 10-degree inclined plane (slope starting at X=0, Z=0, rising along X-axis). Action: Drive the rover forward to push the cube uphill. Verification: The rover must successfully push the cube at least 5 meters uphill along the incline within 500 frames.
verification: Push object uphill

instruction: Task: Construct a precision-controlled rover with accurate stopping capability. Structure: Create a central rectangular chassis platform measuring 3.0m long (X-axis), 1.5m wide (Y-axis), and 0.4m thick (Z-axis), positioned with its bottom face at Z=0. Add four identical cylindrical wheels with radius 0.3m and depth 0.15m. Assembly: Position the wheels at the four corners of the chassis platform, aligned with the chassis edges. Attach each wheel to the chassis using Hinge Constraints oriented along the X-axis (for forward/backward rotation). Use FIXED constraints to ensure the chassis components are rigidly bonded. Actuation: Configure all four hinge constraints as MOTOR type with a target velocity of 3.5. Action: The rover must drive forward along the positive X-axis. Verification: The rover must start at position (0,0,0) and stop within 0.5 meters of a target point located at (10,0,0) after the motors are deactivated, ensuring precise control and minimal overshoot.
verification: The rover must start at (0,0,0) and stop within 0.5 meters of the target point (10,0,0) after the motors are deactivated, demonstrating accurate stopping precision.

instruction: Task: Construct a robust, motorized heavy chassis designed for stable driving. Structure: Create a large, durable central chassis platform (size 6x3x1 meters) from a cube to serve as the main body. Add four cylindrical wheels (radius 0.8 meters, depth 0.3 meters) for support and mobility. Assembly: Position the chassis platform at (0,0,0.8) to elevate it above ground (Z=0). Attach each wheel to the underside of the chassis at its four corners using Hinge Constraints aligned along the X-axis, ensuring they are spaced symmetrically for balance. Actuation: Set all four hinge constraints to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 3.0 to enable forward driving motion. Action: Initiate the drive sequence to propel the chassis forward. Verification: The heavy chassis must start at (0,0,0.8) and travel at least +10 meters along the X-axis while maintaining stability (no tipping or excessive wobbling) within 300 frames.
verification: The heavy chassis must start at (0,0,0.8) and travel at least +10 meters along the X-axis while maintaining stability (no tipping or excessive wobbling) within 300 frames.

instruction: Task: Construct a compact motorized mini rover. Structure: Create a central chassis platform as a cube with dimensions 2.0 meters (length) x 1.5 meters (width) x 0.3 meters (height). Add four cylindrical wheels, each with a radius of 0.3 meters and a depth of 0.15 meters. Assembly: Position the chassis at ground level (Z=0). Attach each wheel to the chassis at its four corners using Hinge Constraints aligned along the X-axis, ensuring the wheels are symmetrically placed and can rotate freely. Actuation: Configure all four hinge constraints as MOTOR type with a target velocity of 6.0 to drive the rover forward. Action: Initiate the rover at the origin (0,0,0) and command it to drive along the positive Y-axis. Verification: The mini rover must start at (0,0,0) and reach a position where Y > 8 meters within 200 frames.
verification: The mini rover must start at (0,0,0) and reach a position where Y > 8 meters within 200 frames.

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized platform rover designed for stable driving. Structure: Create a central rectangular platform (size 6x4x0.5 meters) positioned at Z=0.25 to serve as the chassis. Add four cylindrical wheels (radius 0.6 meters, depth 0.3 meters) for mobility. Assembly: Attach each wheel to the underside of the platform at the four corners using Hinge Constraints aligned along the X-axis, ensuring proper clearance. Actuation: Configure all four hinges as MOTOR type with a target velocity of 4.0 to enable forward driving motion. Action: Initiate the rover to drive straight along the positive X-axis from its starting position at (0,0,0.25).
verification: The rover must maintain stability with no tilt exceeding 5 degrees in any direction throughout its motion, verified by monitoring orientation angles over the simulation duration.

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized carrier rover capable of transporting a load. Structure: Create a central rectangular chassis platform (size 5x3x0.5 meters) at Z=0.5 to serve as the base. Add four cylindrical wheels (radius 0.6 meters, depth 0.25 meters) positioned at the corners of the chassis. On top of the chassis, place a load-carrying box (size 2x2x1 meters) centered on the platform. Assembly: Attach each wheel to the chassis using Hinge Constraints aligned along the X-axis at the wheel centers. Bond the load box to the chassis using a FIXED Constraint to ensure it remains securely attached during movement. Actuation: Set all four hinge joints to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 3.5 to drive the rover forward. Action: The rover must drive along the positive X-axis. Verification: The rover, with the load attached, must start at position (0,0,0) and travel at least 12 meters along the X-axis within 300 frames, maintaining the load's position relative to the chassis throughout the motion.
verification: The carrier rover must transport the load over a distance of 12 meters along the X-axis without detachment or significant deviation.

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized crawler robot with a tracked locomotion system. Structure: Create a central chassis platform (size 3x1.5x0.4) at ground level (Z=0). For the crawler mechanism, build two identical track assemblies on each side of the chassis. Each track assembly consists of: 1) A front drive wheel (cylinder with radius 0.4, depth 0.2) positioned at the front-left and front-right corners of the chassis, 2) A rear idler wheel (cylinder with radius 0.4, depth 0.2) positioned at the rear-left and rear-right corners of the chassis, and 3) Four track segments (cubes sized 0.8x0.2x0.1) arranged in a continuous loop around each wheel pair. Assembly: Attach the front drive wheels to the chassis using Hinge Constraints along the X-axis (for forward/backward rotation). Connect the rear idler wheels to the chassis using Hinge Constraints along the X-axis (free-rotating). Connect each track segment to adjacent segments using Hinge Constraints to form flexible chains. Attach the track chains to both wheels in each assembly using Hinge Constraints at contact points. Actuation: Set both front drive wheel hinges to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 4.0 to drive the tracks forward. Action: The robot should drive upward along an inclined plane (create a ramp with slope 30 degrees starting at X=0, Z=0 and extending to Z>10). Verification: The crawler robot must start at position (0,0,0) and reach a Z-coordinate greater than 10 meters within 500 frames while maintaining contact with the ramp surface.
verification: The crawler robot reaches Z > 10 meters while driving up the inclined ramp.

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized rover with dual-motor actuation. Structure: Create a central chassis platform (size 3x1.5x0.4) positioned at (0,0,0.2) to ensure clearance. Add two cylindrical wheels (radius 0.4, depth 0.15) on each side of the chassis for a total of four wheels. Assembly: Attach the left-side wheels to the chassis using Hinge Constraints along the X-axis, and similarly attach the right-side wheels with Hinge Constraints along the X-axis. Actuation: Set the left-side hinges to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 5.0, and set the right-side hinges to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 5.0 to enable synchronized driving. Action: Activate the motors to drive the rover forward along the Z-axis. Verification: The rover must start at (0,0,0) and reach the target position (0,0,15) within 300 frames.
verification: The rover must start at (0,0,0) and reach the target position (0,0,15) within 300 frames.

instruction: Task: Construct a catapult mechanism with a rotating arm. Structure: Create a base platform (size 3x3x0.3) positioned at Z=0. Build a catapult arm as a rectangular beam (size 0.2x2x0.2) oriented along the Y-axis, with one end positioned at the center of the base platform at coordinates (0,0,0.3). Assembly: Attach the catapult arm to the base platform using a HINGE constraint aligned along the X-axis at the connection point (0,0,0.3). Actuation: Set the hinge constraint to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity of 6.0 radians per second. Action: The arm should rotate upward from its initial horizontal position to launch a projectile. Verification: Place a spherical projectile (radius 0.15) at the free end of the arm. When activated, the catapult must launch the projectile such that it travels more than 10 meters horizontally from its starting point within 100 frames.
verification: The projectile must be launched from the catapult arm and travel a horizontal distance greater than 10 meters from its initial position.

instruction: Task: Construct a spring-loaded catapult with a release hinge mechanism. Structure: 1) Base platform (size 3x3x0.5) positioned at ground level (Z=0). 2) Launch arm (size 0.2x2x0.2) attached to the base at one end using a Hinge Constraint along the X-axis, allowing vertical rotation. 3) Spring mechanism: A compressed spring (cylinder with radius 0.1, height 0.5) placed between the base and launch arm, applying force to push the arm upward. 4) Release hinge lock: A locking mechanism (small cube, size 0.1x0.1x0.1) attached to the base with a Hinge Constraint along the Y-axis, positioned to hold the launch arm in a loaded position. 5) Projectile: A spherical projectile (radius 0.2) placed on the launch arm's free end. Assembly: Attach the launch arm hinge to the base at (0,0,0.5) with the hinge axis along X. Position the spring at (0,0.5,0.25) between the base and arm. Set the release hinge lock at (0.1,1.5,0.5) to engage with the launch arm. Use FIXED Constraints for all non-moving connections (e.g., spring to base). Actuation: Initially, set the release hinge lock to a MOTOR type with zero velocity to hold the arm. At frame 50, release the lock by disabling the motor or setting it to free movement, allowing the spring to propel the launch arm and launch the projectile. Verification: The projectile must be launched from the catapult and reach a vertical height (Y-coordinate) greater than 8 meters within 250 frames.
verification: Projectile reaches Y > 8 meters within 250 frames after release.

instruction: Task: Construct a gravity-powered catapult with a swinging arm mechanism. Structure: Build a base platform (size 3x3x0.5) positioned on the ground at Z=0. Create a vertical support column (size 0.5x0.5x3) attached to the center of the base using a FIXED constraint. Construct a swinging arm (size 0.3x3x0.3) with one end attached to the top of the support column using a HINGE constraint aligned along the Y-axis, allowing rotation in the XZ plane. Add a projectile holder (size 0.4x0.4x0.4) at the free end of the arm using a FIXED constraint. Assembly: Ensure all parts are properly aligned with the arm's hinge point at (0,0,3) relative to the base center. Actuation: Configure the HINGE constraint as a MOTOR type with a target velocity of 5.0 to simulate the arm's swing. Action: Position a spherical projectile (radius 0.2) in the holder. When activated, the motorized hinge will swing the arm upward, launching the projectile via gravitational and centrifugal forces. Verification: The catapult must launch the projectile from rest to a maximum height where Z > 6 meters above ground level within 100 frames.
verification: Launch object to Z > 6

instruction: Task: Construct a dual-arm catapult with motorized hinges for launching. Structure: Create a base platform (size 4x2x0.5) at Z=0. On top of the base, build two identical catapult arms, each consisting of a vertical support (size 0.2x0.2x2) and a horizontal throwing arm (size 0.2x0.2x3). Position the arms symmetrically on the base, with the vertical supports placed at (1,0.5,0.5) and (3,0.5,0.5) relative to the base's center. Attach the throwing arms to the vertical supports using Hinge Constraints along the Y-axis at the top of each support. Actuation: Set both hinges to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 5.0 to rotate the arms upward. Action: Rotate arms simultaneously from a horizontal starting position (parallel to the base) to a vertical position (perpendicular to the base) to simulate launching. Verification: Place a projectile (cube of size 0.2x0.2x0.2) at the end of each throwing arm initially. Upon activation, the catapult must launch both projectiles to a distance greater than 12 meters from the starting point along the X-axis within 100 frames.
verification: The catapult must launch both projectiles to a distance greater than 12 meters from the starting point along the X-axis within 100 frames.

instruction: Task: Construct a high-angle catapult capable of launching a projectile to a significant height. Structure: Build a base platform (size 3x3x0.5) at ground level (Z=0). Erect a vertical support beam (size 0.5x0.5x4) positioned at the center of the base's rear edge. Create a throwing arm (size 0.3x3x0.3) with one end attached to the top of the support beam using a Hinge Constraint along the X-axis, allowing rotation in the vertical plane. At the free end of the throwing arm, attach a projectile holder (cube, size 0.5x0.5x0.5). Assembly: Bond the base to the ground with FIXED constraints. Use a Hinge Constraint to connect the throwing arm to the support beam, ensuring the hinge axis is horizontal (X-direction) for vertical rotation. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 4.0 to rotate the throwing arm upward. Verification: The catapult must launch the projectile from rest, and the projectile must reach a maximum height (Y-coordinate) greater than 10 meters above ground level.
verification: Projectile reaches height Y > 10

instruction: Task: Construct a fast catapult mechanism. Structure: A base platform (size 3x2x0.5) positioned on the ground at Z=0. A catapult arm (size 0.2x2x0.2) made of a cube, oriented vertically with its bottom end attached to the base at the center using a Hinge Constraint along the Y-axis. A projectile (size 0.3x0.3x0.3) placed at the top end of the arm. Assembly: Bond the base to the ground with a FIXED Constraint. Attach the catapult arm to the base with a Hinge Constraint at the pivot point (center of the base, height 0.25). Place the projectile on the arm's top end and bond it with a FIXED Constraint. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 8.0, configured to release the projectile by deactivating the hinge after a set time or angle. Verification: The catapult must launch the projectile from rest at (0,0,0.5), and the projectile must travel more than 15 meters horizontally from the launch point within 100 frames.
verification: The projectile travels > 15m horizontally from the launch point.

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized catapult with a controlled firing mechanism. Structure: A base platform (size 3x3x0.5) positioned on the ground at Z=0. A vertical support arm (size 0.2x0.2x2) attached to the center of the base. A rotating throwing arm (size 0.15x0.15x2.5) connected to the top of the support arm using a Hinge Constraint along the Y-axis. A projectile holder (cube size 0.3x0.3x0.3) attached to the end of the throwing arm. Assembly: Fix the base to the ground with FIXED constraints. Attach the support arm to the base with FIXED constraints. Connect the throwing arm to the support arm with a Hinge Constraint at the pivot point. Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 5.0. Actuation: The catapult should be positioned to fire a projectile. Upon activation, the motor will rotate the throwing arm to launch the projectile. Verification: The catapult must start with the throwing arm in a loaded position (e.g., angled downward). When fired, the projectile must be launched and hit a target zone defined as a 2x2 meter area centered at coordinates (10, 0, 0) on the ground within 100 frames.
verification: The catapult's projectile must successfully land within the target zone at (10, 0, 0) after firing.

instruction: Task: Construct a side-launch catapult mechanism. Structure: Create a base platform (size 3x3x0.5) positioned on the ground at Z=0. Build a catapult arm as a rectangular beam (size 0.2x2x0.2) with one end attached to the base via a Hinge Constraint along the Y-axis, allowing rotation in the X-Z plane. Add a projectile as a small cube (size 0.3x0.3x0.3) placed at the free end of the arm. Assembly: Use a FIXED Constraint to bond the base to the ground. Attach the catapult arm to the base with a Hinge Constraint at the pivot point (positioned at one end of the arm). Place the projectile at the tip of the arm, ensuring it is initially in contact. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity to achieve a rapid rotation (e.g., 10.0 rad/s) in the direction that launches the projectile sideways. Action: The catapult arm rotates around the hinge axis, propelling the projectile. Verification: The projectile must be launched and move horizontally along the X-axis more than 8 meters from its starting position within 100 frames.
verification: Projectile moves X > 8

instruction: Task: Construct a heavy catapult with a swinging arm mechanism. Structure: Base platform (size 5x3x0.5) positioned on the ground at Z=0. Arm: A long rectangular arm (size 0.3x4x0.3) attached to the base at one end using a Hinge Constraint along the Y-axis, allowing rotation in the X-Z plane. Counterweight: A heavy block (size 1x1x1) fixed to the base near the hinge side. Projectile: A heavy block (size 0.8x0.8x0.8) placed at the free end of the arm. Assembly: Fix the base to the ground with FIXED constraints. Attach the arm to the base with a Hinge Constraint at (0,0,0.5) relative to base center, aligned along Y-axis. Fix the counterweight to the base near the hinge. Place the projectile on the arm's free end, initially resting on the ground. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 3.0 to swing the arm upward. Verification: The catapult must launch the heavy projectile from rest, and it should travel horizontally more than 6 meters from its starting position along the X-axis after the arm swings.
verification: Launch heavy block > 6m horizontally from starting position after arm swing.

instruction: Task: Construct a dual-hinge catapult mechanism for launching a projectile. Structure: Create a base platform (size 3x2x0.5) at ground level (Z=0). Build an arm (size 0.2x2x0.2) attached to the base at one end using a Hinge Constraint along the Y-axis (hinge 1). Attach a second arm (size 0.2x1.5x0.2) to the free end of the first arm using another Hinge Constraint along the Y-axis (hinge 2). Place a projectile (cube, size 0.3x0.3x0.3) at the free end of the second arm. Assembly: Use FIXED Constraints to bond the base to the ground and the arms to each other at the hinges. Actuation: Set both hinges to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 5.0 to trigger simultaneously, simulating the catapult action. Verification: The projectile must be launched and travel a horizontal distance greater than 10 meters from its starting position within 100 frames.
verification: Projectile > 10m

instruction: Task: Construct a vertical catapult mechanism. Structure: Build a base platform (size 3x3x0.5) centered at (0,0,0). On top of the base, place a vertical support column (size 0.5x0.5x4) positioned at (0,0,0.5). At the top of the support column, attach a rotating arm (size 3x0.3x0.3) using a Hinge Constraint along the X-axis at the pivot point (0,0,4.5). The arm should extend horizontally from the pivot. At the far end of the arm, attach a projectile holder (size 0.5x0.5x0.5) using a FIXED constraint. Actuation: Set the hinge at the pivot to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 6.0 to rotate the arm upward. Action: The catapult arm rotates from a horizontal starting position to a vertical position, launching the projectile upward. Verification: The projectile must achieve a maximum height greater than 12 meters above ground level (Z=0) during the simulation.
verification: Projectile height > 12

instruction: Task: Construct a long-arm catapult mechanism. Structure: Create a base platform (size 3x2x0.3) positioned on the ground at Z=0. Build a vertical support column (size 0.3x0.3x2) attached to the center of the base using a FIXED constraint. Create a long throwing arm (size 0.2x0.2x4) with a bucket at the end (size 0.5x0.5x0.3). Assembly: Attach the throwing arm to the top of the support column using a HINGE constraint along the Y-axis at the pivot point. Add a counterweight (size 0.8x0.8x0.8) at the opposite end of the arm. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 5.0 to simulate the firing action. Place a projectile sphere (radius 0.2) in the bucket. Verification: When activated, the catapult must launch the projectile, which should travel a horizontal distance greater than 14 meters from the launch point.
verification: The projectile must achieve a horizontal displacement exceeding 14 meters from its initial position when the catapult is fired.

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized catapult with a stable base and a launching arm. Structure: 1. Base: A rectangular platform (size 3x2x0.5) positioned at Z=0 for stability. 2. Arm: A long rectangular arm (size 0.2x2.5x0.2) attached to the base. 3. Counterweight: A cube (size 1x1x1) attached to the rear end of the arm for balance. 4. Projectile: A small cube (size 0.2x0.2x0.2) placed at the front end of the arm. Assembly: Attach the arm to the base at its center using a Hinge Constraint along the Y-axis. Bond the counterweight to the rear of the arm and the projectile to the front of the arm using FIXED Constraints. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 4.5. Action: Release the projectile by deactivating the FIXED constraint between the arm and projectile after 50 frames. Verification: The catapult must have a stable base (no tipping) and launch the projectile to a horizontal distance greater than 9 meters from the starting point.
verification: Stable base + launch > 9m

instruction: Task: Construct a functional pivot catapult that launches a projectile. Structure: Create a base platform (size 3x3x0.5) at ground level (Z=0). Build a vertical support column (size 0.5x0.5x2) centered on the base. Attach a horizontal throwing arm (size 3x0.2x0.2) to the top of the support column using a Hinge Constraint along the Y-axis, allowing rotation in the vertical plane. At the free end of the throwing arm, attach a projectile (a cube of size 0.3x0.3x0.3). Assembly: Use FIXED Constraints to bond the base to the ground, the support column to the base, and the projectile to the throwing arm. Set the hinge between the support column and throwing arm to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity of 5.0 rad/s to simulate the catapult's action. Position the catapult at (0,0,0) with the throwing arm initially horizontal. Verification: The catapult must launch the projectile such that it reaches a maximum height (Z-coordinate) greater than 7 meters above ground level within 100 frames.
verification: Projectile reaches Z > 7

instruction: Task: Construct a dual-stage catapult with sequential hinges for launching a projectile. Structure: Create a base platform (size 4x2x0.5) at ground level (Z=0). Build a first-stage arm (size 0.2x2x0.2) attached to the base at one end using a Hinge Constraint along the Y-axis. Attach a second-stage arm (size 0.2x1.5x0.2) to the free end of the first-stage arm using another Hinge Constraint along the Y-axis. Place a projectile (cube, size 0.3x0.3x0.3) at the tip of the second-stage arm. Assembly: Use FIXED constraints to bond the base to the ground and the arms to each other at the hinges. Actuation: Set both hinges to MOTOR type with sequential triggering: first hinge activates at frame 0 with a target velocity of 6.0, second hinge activates at frame 10 with a target velocity of 8.0. Verification: The projectile must launch from the catapult and travel a horizontal distance greater than 16 meters along the X-axis from its starting position within 100 frames.
verification: Projectile > 16m

instruction: Task: Construct a crane-catapult hybrid mechanism. Structure: A base platform (size 3x3x0.5) at ground level (Z=0). Attach a vertical crane arm (size 0.2x0.2x4) to the center of the base using a Hinge Constraint along the Z-axis for rotation. At the top of the crane arm, attach a catapult arm (size 0.15x0.15x2) using a Hinge Constraint along the X-axis for tilting. Place a projectile (sphere, radius 0.2) at the end of the catapult arm. Assembly: Use FIXED Constraints to bond the base to ground, the crane arm to the base, and the catapult arm to the crane arm. Actuation: First, set the crane hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 2.0 to rotate 90 degrees clockwise. Then, set the catapult hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 5.0 to release the projectile by tilting downward. Verification: The projectile must launch from the catapult and travel a horizontal distance greater than 10 meters from the starting point.
verification: Projectile > 10m

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized fast-release catapult for launching objects. Structure: Build a base platform (size 3x3x0.5) at ground level (Z=0). Erect a vertical support arm (size 0.2x0.2x2.5) at the center of the platform's back edge. Attach a horizontal throwing arm (size 0.15x0.15x2.0) to the top of the support arm using a Hinge Constraint along the Y-axis, with the hinge positioned at the joint. Add a projectile holder (cube, size 0.3x0.3x0.3) at the free end of the throwing arm. Assembly: Use FIXED Constraints to bond the base platform to the ground, the support arm to the platform, and the projectile holder to the throwing arm. Actuation: Set the hinge between the support and throwing arms to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 7.0, configured to rotate the throwing arm upward (positive rotation around Y-axis) to simulate a fast release. Action: Initiate the motor to release the projectile from the holder. Verification: The catapult must launch the projectile from its starting position at (0,0,0.3) to achieve a horizontal distance greater than 13 meters along the X-axis within 150 frames.
verification: Launch > 13m

instruction: Task: Construct a torque-powered catapult mechanism. Structure: A base platform (size 3x3x0.5) anchored to the ground at Z=0. A vertical support column (size 0.3x0.3x2.5) positioned at the rear center of the base. A catapult arm (size 0.2x2.0x0.2) attached to the top of the support column using a Hinge Constraint along the Y-axis, allowing rotation in the vertical plane. A heavy projectile object (cube, size 0.5x0.5x0.5) placed at the free end of the arm. Assembly: Fix the base to the ground with FIXED constraints. Bond the support column to the base with FIXED constraints. Attach the catapult arm to the support column with a Hinge Constraint at the pivot point. Place the projectile on the arm's end, initially secured with a temporary FIXED constraint that releases upon launch. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 3.0 to swing the arm forward. Verification: The catapult must launch the heavy projectile from rest at (0,0,0) to a horizontal distance greater than 7 meters along the X-axis, with the arm completing a swing motion.
verification: The heavy projectile object must be launched to a horizontal distance > 7m from the starting point along the X-axis.

instruction: Task: Construct a wide-base catapult mechanism. Structure: Create a base platform (size 6x4x0.5) centered at (0,0,0) on the ground. Build a vertical support column (size 0.5x0.5x2) positioned at the center of the base's rear edge. Attach a horizontal throwing arm (size 4x0.3x0.3) to the top of the support column using a Hinge Constraint along the Y-axis, with the hinge point at the arm's rear end. Add a counterweight bucket (size 1x1x0.5) at the rear end of the arm, and a projectile holder (size 0.3x0.3x0.2) at the front end. Assembly: Use FIXED Constraints to bond the base to the ground, the support column to the base, and the bucket/holder to the arm. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of -8.0 (downward rotation) to simulate firing. Verification: The catapult must remain stable (no tipping or structural failure) after firing, and the projectile must travel a horizontal distance greater than 11 meters from its starting position.
verification: Stable + distance > 11m

instruction: Task: Construct a compact motorized catapult for launching projectiles. Structure: A base platform (size 2x2x0.2) at ground level (Z=0). A vertical support column (size 0.2x0.2x1.5) fixed to the center of the base. A rotating arm (size 0.15x0.15x2) attached to the top of the support column using a Hinge Constraint along the Y-axis (allowing rotation in the XZ plane). A projectile holder (size 0.3x0.3x0.3) fixed to the free end of the arm. A counterweight (size 0.4x0.4x0.4) fixed to the arm near the hinge. Assembly: Fix the base to the ground. Fix the support column to the base. Attach the arm to the support column with a Hinge Constraint at (0,0,1.5). Fix the projectile holder at the arm's end (at (0,0,3.5) relative to hinge). Fix the counterweight on the arm opposite the holder (at (0,0,0.5) relative to hinge). Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of -10.0 (negative for forward firing motion). Verification: The catapult must start with the arm in a loaded position (rotated 45 degrees backward from vertical). When activated, it must fire the projectile, which should travel a horizontal distance greater than 8 meters from the launch point within 100 frames.
verification: The projectile's launch point is at the catapult base center (0,0,0). After firing, measure the projectile's final X-coordinate; it must be > 8m from the launch point within 100 frames.

instruction: Task: Construct a directional catapult mechanism. Structure: Create a base platform (size 3x3x0.3) positioned on the ground at Z=0. Build a catapult arm as a rectangular beam (size 0.2x2x0.2) with one end positioned at the center of the base's front edge (aligned along X-axis). Assembly: Attach the catapult arm to the base using a Hinge Constraint at the connection point, with the hinge axis aligned along the Y-axis to allow rotation in the vertical plane. Add a projectile as a small cube (size 0.3x0.3x0.3) placed at the free end of the catapult arm. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity to achieve a rapid rotation (e.g., 10 rad/s) in the direction that launches the projectile along the +X axis. Verification: The catapult must start at position (0,0,0), and upon activation, the projectile should be launched and travel more than 9 meters in the +X direction from its starting point.
verification: Projectile goes +X > 9m

instruction: Task: Construct a precision catapult capable of firing a projectile to hit a target. Structure: Build a base platform (size 3x3x0.5) positioned at ground level (Z=0). On this base, erect a vertical support beam (size 0.2x0.2x2) at the center. At the top of the support beam, attach a horizontal throwing arm (size 2x0.1x0.1) using a Hinge Constraint along the Y-axis, allowing rotation in the X-Z plane. The throwing arm should have a projectile holder (a small cube, size 0.1x0.1x0.1) at its free end. Assembly: Fix the base platform to the ground with FIXED constraints. Bond the vertical support beam to the base with FIXED constraints. Connect the throwing arm to the support beam with a Hinge Constraint at the pivot point. Attach the projectile holder to the end of the throwing arm with FIXED constraints. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 10.0 to simulate the firing action, ensuring the arm rotates rapidly to launch the projectile. Verification: The catapult must start with the projectile at (0,0,2.5) and, upon firing, hit the target located at (0,0,10) within 100 frames, with the projectile's trajectory being accurate to within 0.5 meters of the target coordinates.
verification: The catapult's projectile must successfully hit the target at coordinates (0,0,10) within 0.5 meters accuracy after firing, as verified within 100 frames of simulation.

instruction: Task: Construct a dual-arm launcher capable of launching a projectile. Structure: Build a base platform (size 2x2x0.3) at ground level (Z=0). On top of the base, create two vertical support arms (each size 0.2x0.2x1.5) positioned symmetrically at X=±0.8. Attach a horizontal launch arm (size 2.0x0.1x0.1) between the tops of the support arms using Hinge Constraints at both ends, aligned along the Y-axis for rotation. Place a cylindrical projectile (radius 0.1, height 0.2) at the center of the launch arm. Assembly: Fix the base to the ground with FIXED Constraints. Connect the launch arm to each support arm with Hinge Constraints, ensuring free rotation. Actuation: Set both hinges to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity of 6.0 rad/s to rotate the launch arm upward. Verification: The projectile must be launched and travel a horizontal distance greater than 12 meters from the starting point within 200 frames.
verification: Projectile > 12m

instruction: Task: Construct a lever catapult mechanism. Structure: Create a base platform (size 3x3x0.5) positioned on the ground at Z=0. Build a lever arm (size 0.2x4x0.2) with one end positioned at the center of the base platform. Add a counterweight (size 1x1x1) at the short end of the lever arm. Assembly: Attach the lever arm to the base platform using a Hinge Constraint along the Y-axis at the pivot point (center of base). Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 6.0 to swing the lever arm. Verification: The catapult must launch a projectile (size 0.3x0.3x0.3) placed on the long end of the lever arm, achieving a maximum height greater than 9 meters above ground.
verification: Height > 9

instruction: Task: Construct a fast-snap catapult mechanism. Structure: Build a base platform (size 3x2x0.3) at ground level (Z=0). Create an arm (size 0.2x2x0.2) positioned vertically on the base, with its bottom end fixed to the base using a FIXED constraint. Add a projectile (cylinder with radius 0.15, depth 0.3) placed at the top end of the arm. Assembly: Attach the projectile to the arm using a Hinge Constraint along the Y-axis at the connection point. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a high initial torque for fast release, triggered to release at frame 50. Verification: The catapult must launch the projectile from starting position (0,0,0.5) to achieve a horizontal distance greater than 14 meters along the X-axis within 100 frames.
verification: Distance > 14m

instruction: Task: Construct a heavy-launch catapult mechanism. Structure: A base platform (size 3x3x0.5) at ground level (Z=0). Build a catapult arm as a rectangular beam (size 0.2x2x0.2) with one end positioned at the center of the platform's front edge. Attach a heavy block payload (size 0.8x0.8x0.8) to the free end of the arm. Assembly: Fix the base platform to the ground using FIXED constraints. Connect the catapult arm to the platform at the pivot point using a HINGE constraint along the Y-axis (allowing rotation in the X-Z plane). Attach the heavy block to the arm's end using FIXED constraints. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a high torque impulse to simulate firing - apply a target velocity of 15.0 for 10 frames then set to 0. Verification: The heavy block must be launched and achieve a horizontal displacement greater than 6 meters from its starting position.
verification: Heavy block > 6m

instruction: Task: Construct a crane-mounted catapult mechanism. Structure: 1. Base: A stationary ground platform (size 3x3x0.5) at Z=0. 2. Crane: A vertical support column (cylinder, radius 0.2, height 4) fixed to the base center. 3. Boom: A horizontal arm (cube, size 4x0.3x0.3) attached to the top of the crane column using a Hinge Constraint along the Z-axis for rotation. 4. Catapult: A throwing arm (cube, size 2x0.2x0.2) hinged at one end to the boom's free end using a Hinge Constraint along the Y-axis. 5. Projectile: A spherical object (cube, size 0.2x0.2x0.2) placed in a cup or holder at the free end of the throwing arm. Assembly: Fix the base to the ground. Attach the crane column to the base with a FIXED constraint. Connect the boom to the crane top with a HINGE constraint (Z-axis rotation). Attach the catapult arm to the boom end with a HINGE constraint (Y-axis rotation). Place the projectile in the catapult's holder. Actuation: Set the boom hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity for controlled rotation (e.g., 2.0 rad/s) to aim. Set the catapult arm hinge to MOTOR type with a quick release action (e.g., high velocity impulse) to launch the projectile. Sequence: Rotate the boom to desired angle, then activate the catapult release. Verification: The projectile must be launched and travel a horizontal distance greater than 10 meters from the launch point.
verification: Projectile achieves a horizontal displacement > 10m from launch point.

instruction: Task: Construct a base-mounted catapult mechanism. Structure: Create a rectangular base platform (size 3x2x0.3) centered at (0,0,0). Build a vertical support column (size 0.3x0.3x2) positioned at the rear center of the base. Add a rotating arm (size 0.2x0.2x2.5) attached to the top of the support column. Include a projectile holder (cube size 0.4x0.4x0.4) at the free end of the arm. Assembly: Fix the base to the ground using FIXED constraint. Attach the support column to the base with FIXED constraint. Connect the rotating arm to the support column using a HINGE constraint along the Y-axis at the pivot point. Secure the projectile holder to the arm with FIXED constraint. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 8.0 to simulate firing action. Verification: The catapult must remain stable (no structural failure) and launch the projectile over 12 meters horizontally from the starting position within 100 frames.
verification: Stable + > 12m

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized catapult turret with a rotating base and a launching arm. Structure: 1) Base platform (size 3x3x0.5) positioned at (0,0,0). 2) Rotating turret base (size 2x2x1) placed on top of the platform. 3) Launching arm (size 0.2x3x0.2) attached to the turret base at one end. Assembly: Attach the turret base to the platform using a Hinge Constraint along the Z-axis at the center of the platform. Attach the launching arm to the turret base using a Hinge Constraint along the Y-axis at the top edge of the turret base. Actuation: Set the base hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity to achieve rotation. Verification: The catapult must launch a projectile (a small cube of size 0.2x0.2x0.2) from the end of the arm in the direction the base is rotated, ensuring the projectile travels at least 10 meters from the origin.
verification: The catapult turret must rotate its base to a specified angle and launch a projectile that travels at least 10 meters in the rotated direction.

instruction: Task: Construct a pivot-based launcher mechanism. Structure: Create a base platform (size 3x3x0.5) positioned on the ground at Z=0. Attach a vertical support column (size 0.5x0.5x2) at the center of the platform. At the top of the support column, attach a horizontal launch arm (size 4x0.3x0.3) using a Hinge Constraint along the Z-axis, allowing rotation in the X-Y plane. Add a projectile (a cube of size 0.5x0.5x0.5) at the far end of the launch arm. Assembly: Bond the base platform to the ground with FIXED constraints. Bond the support column to the platform with FIXED constraints. Attach the launch arm to the support column with a Hinge Constraint at the pivot point. Bond the projectile to the launch arm with FIXED constraints. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity to achieve rapid rotation (e.g., 10.0 rad/s) upon activation. Position the launcher such that the projectile starts at (0,0,2.5). Verification: The projectile must be launched and travel a horizontal distance greater than 11 meters from its starting point.
verification: Projectile > 11m

instruction: Task: Construct a vertical-launch catapult mechanism. Structure: A base platform (size 3x3x0.5) at ground level (Z=0) to provide stability. Assembly: On the base, attach a vertical support arm (size 0.2x0.2x2.5) using a FIXED constraint at its bottom center. At the top of the support arm, attach a horizontal throwing arm (size 0.15x0.15x1.5) using a HINGE constraint along the Y-axis to allow rotation in the vertical plane. At the free end of the throwing arm, attach a projectile holder (size 0.3x0.3x0.3) using a FIXED constraint. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 6.0 to rotate the throwing arm upward for launch. Verification: The catapult must launch the projectile from rest at (0,0,0) to achieve a maximum height greater than 13 meters above ground level (Z > 13) within 100 frames.
verification: Height > 13

instruction: Task: Construct a low-angle projectile launcher. Structure: A base platform (size 3x3x0.5) placed on the ground at Z=0. A launch tube (cylinder with radius 0.3, depth 2.0) positioned at the center of the platform, tilted at a low angle (approximately 15 degrees above horizontal along the X-axis). A projectile (cylinder with radius 0.25, depth 0.5) placed inside the launch tube. Assembly: Attach the launch tube to the base platform using a FIXED Constraint. Attach the projectile to the launch tube using a HINGE Constraint along the X-axis at the rear end of the tube. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a high impulse force to simulate firing, using a target velocity of 20.0 for a short duration (e.g., 10 frames). Verification: The projectile must be launched from the launcher and achieve a horizontal distance greater than 15 meters along the X-axis from its starting point.
verification: The projectile must travel a horizontal distance greater than 15 meters from its launch point.

instruction: Task: Construct a multi-joint catapult with a projectile launch mechanism. Structure: Create a base platform (size 3x3x0.5) at ground level (Z=0). Build a vertical support column (size 0.5x0.5x2) fixed to the center of the base. Attach a horizontal arm (size 3x0.3x0.3) to the top of the support column using a Hinge Constraint along the Z-axis (allowing rotation in the vertical plane). At the far end of the horizontal arm, attach a smaller projectile holder (size 0.5x0.5x0.5) using a second Hinge Constraint along the Z-axis. Assembly: Fix all structural parts (base, column, arm, holder) with FIXED constraints except the two hinges. Place a spherical projectile (radius 0.2) in the holder. Actuation: Set both hinge constraints to MOTOR type. Configure the first hinge (arm to column) with a target velocity of 6.0 to swing the arm upward, and the second hinge (holder to arm) with a target velocity of -8.0 to release the projectile at the peak of motion. Verification: The catapult must launch the projectile from rest at (0,0,0) to achieve a horizontal distance greater than 16 meters along the X-axis within 200 frames.
verification: Projectile > 16m

instruction: Task: Construct a compact projectile launcher. Structure: A base platform (size 2x2x0.3) at ground level (Z=0). Assembly: Place a launch arm (size 0.2x0.2x1.5) vertically on the platform, positioned at the center. Attach the launch arm to the platform using a Hinge Constraint along the Y-axis at the base of the arm. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 0.0 initially, then program it to release (set to free rotation) at frame 10. Verification: The launcher must propel a projectile (a cube of size 0.3x0.3x0.3 placed at the top of the launch arm) to travel a horizontal distance greater than 7 meters from the starting point within 100 frames.
verification: The projectile must achieve a horizontal displacement exceeding 7 meters from its initial position.

instruction: Task: Construct a high-speed launcher mechanism to propel a projectile. Structure: Create a stationary base (size 2x2x0.3) positioned on the ground at Z=0. Attach a rotating arm (size 0.2x2x0.2) to the base's center using a Hinge Constraint along the Z-axis. Place a cylindrical projectile (radius 0.15, height 0.3) at the free end of the arm. Assembly: Bond the base to the ground with a FIXED Constraint. Connect the arm to the base with a Hinge Constraint, ensuring it rotates freely. Attach the projectile to the arm's end using a FIXED Constraint. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 9.0 to spin the arm rapidly. Verification: The projectile must be launched from the arm and travel a horizontal distance greater than 18 meters from its starting point within 100 frames.
verification: The projectile must travel more than 18 meters horizontally from its launch position.

instruction: Task: Construct a controlled projectile launcher. Structure: Create a base platform (size 3x3x0.5) at ground level (Z=0). Build a vertical launch tube (cylinder with radius 0.2, height 2.0) positioned at the center of the platform. Create a spherical projectile (radius 0.15) placed inside the top of the launch tube. Assembly: Attach the launch tube to the base platform using a FIXED Constraint. Attach the projectile to the launch tube using a HINGE Constraint aligned along the vertical Z-axis. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 25.0 to simulate firing action. Verification: The launcher must be positioned at (0,0,0). When activated, the projectile should be fired and land within 1 meter of a target point located at (10,0,0) on the ground plane.
verification: The projectile must land within 1 meter of the target point at (10,0,0) after being fired from the launcher at (0,0,0).

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized catapult with a stable base. Structure: Create a rectangular base platform (size 6x4x0.5) positioned at Z=0 to serve as the foundation. On top of this base, build a catapult arm using a long rectangular beam (size 5x0.3x0.3) oriented vertically at one end of the base. Attach the catapult arm to the base using a Hinge Constraint along the Y-axis at the base's edge (positioned at X=3, Y=0 relative to base center). Add a projectile holder (a small cube, size 0.5x0.5x0.5) at the free end of the arm. Assembly: Use FIXED Constraints to bond the base to the ground and the projectile holder to the arm. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 10.0 to simulate the firing action. Verification: The catapult must fire the projectile, causing the base to tilt and shift, with the base's center moving at least 9 meters horizontally from its starting position at (0,0,0) within 100 frames.
verification: The base must tilt and move horizontally by at least 9 meters from its origin after firing the catapult.

instruction: Task: Construct a side-arm launcher mechanism. Structure: Create a base platform (size 2x2x0.3) positioned at (0,0,0). Attach a vertical support arm (size 0.2x0.2x1.5) to the base at (0,0,0.3) using a FIXED constraint. At the top of the support arm, attach a horizontal launcher arm (size 1.5x0.2x0.2) using a HINGE constraint along the Z-axis, allowing rotation in the X-Y plane. Add a projectile (cylinder with radius 0.1, depth 0.3) at the end of the launcher arm, attached with a FIXED constraint. Assembly: Ensure the hinge is positioned at the joint between the support and launcher arms. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity to achieve a rapid rotation, simulating a launch motion. Verification: The projectile must be launched and travel more than 10 meters along the X-axis from its starting position.
verification: Projectile X > 10m

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized crane-launcher mechanism. Structure: A base platform (size 3x3x0.5) at ground level (Z=0). Attach a vertical support column (size 0.5x0.5x4) at the center of the platform using a FIXED constraint. At the top of the column, attach a horizontal boom (size 4x0.5x0.5) using a HINGE constraint along the Z-axis to allow vertical rotation. At the end of the boom, attach a cylindrical projectile holder (radius 0.2, depth 0.5) using a HINGE constraint along the Y-axis to allow horizontal rotation. Assembly: Ensure all connections are rigid except the two hinge joints. Actuation: Set the boom hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 2.0 to lift the projectile vertically. Set the projectile holder hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 5.0 to fire the projectile horizontally.
