Verification: The projectile must be launched from the holder and travel more than 12 meters horizontally from the base origin within 100 frames.
verification: Projectile > 12m

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized robot with front-wheel steering. Structure: Create a rectangular chassis platform (size 3x1.5x0.4) at Z=0.4. Add four cylindrical wheels (radius 0.3, depth 0.15) - two front wheels positioned at the front corners of the chassis (X=±1.2, Y=0.75) and two rear wheels at the rear corners (X=±1.2, Y=-0.75). Assembly: Attach all wheels to the chassis using Hinge Constraints along their local Z-axes. For the front wheels, set the hinge limits to ±30° rotation range. For the rear wheels, use FIXED constraints to prevent rotation. Actuation: Set both front hinges to MOTOR type with a target rotation angle of -30° (left turn). Action: Activate the steering motors to execute a left turn. Verification: The robot must change its heading by more than 30° from its initial orientation within 100 frames.
verification: Robot changes heading > 30° from initial orientation.

instruction: Task: Construct a robot with rear-wheel steering capability. Structure: Create a rectangular chassis platform (size 3x1.5x0.4) at Z=0.4. Add two cylindrical front wheels (radius 0.3, depth 0.15) at the front corners (positions: (-1.2, ±0.75, 0.3)) and two cylindrical rear wheels (radius 0.3, depth 0.15) at the rear corners (positions: (1.2, ±0.75, 0.3)). Assembly: Attach all wheels to the chassis using Hinge Constraints along the Y-axis for rotation. For the rear wheels only, add an additional Hinge Constraint along the Z-axis to enable steering. Actuation: Set the rear wheel Z-axis hinges to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 0.0 initially. Action: Activate the rear hinge motors to steer the robot. Verification: The robot must start at (0,0,0.4) and, when the rear hinge motors are activated to turn the wheels, the robot should curve to the right along a curved path.
verification: Robot curves right when rear hinge motors are activated.

instruction: Task: Construct a servo steering system for a vehicle. Structure: Create a main chassis platform (size 2x1x0.3) at Z=0.3 to represent the vehicle base. Add a steering column: a vertical cylinder (radius 0.05, height 0.4) centered on the chassis at (0,0,0.3) and extending upward. Attach a steering arm: a horizontal rectangular bar (size 0.6x0.1x0.05) positioned at the top of the steering column, aligned with the Y-axis. Add two tie rods: create two small cylinders (radius 0.02, length 0.3) extending from the ends of the steering arm at angles downward to connect to simulated wheel hubs (represented by small cubes of size 0.1x0.1x0.1 at Z=0.2). Assembly: Bond the chassis to ground with a FIXED constraint. Attach the steering column to the chassis with a Hinge Constraint along the Z-axis (vertical rotation axis) at the base. Bond the steering arm to the top of the steering column with a FIXED constraint. Attach each tie rod to the steering arm and its respective wheel hub with Hinge Constraints at both ends, allowing rotation in the X-Y plane. Actuation: Set the hinge at the base of the steering column to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity to achieve rotation. Configure the motor to rotate the hinge, causing the steering column and attached components to turn, simulating servo steering action. Verification: The system must start with the steering arm aligned along the Y-axis (0° heading). Activate the motor to rotate the hinge; the heading of the steering arm must change by more than 25° from its initial position, measured as the angular displacement around the Z-axis, within a specified frame range (e.g., 100 frames).
verification: The servo steering system must demonstrate a heading change of the steering arm greater than 25° from its initial Y-axis alignment when the hinge motor is activated.

instruction: Task: Construct a rack-and-pinion steering mechanism for a robot. Structure: Create a central rack bar (size 3x0.2x0.1) aligned along the X-axis. Add two steering knuckles (size 0.5x0.3x0.2) positioned symmetrically at each end of the rack. Attach two cylindrical wheels (radius 0.3, depth 0.15) to the knuckles using Hinge Constraints along the Z-axis for vertical rotation. Assembly: Connect the rack bar to a fixed base platform (size 4x2x0.5) using a Hinge Constraint along the Y-axis at the rack's center, allowing lateral movement. Link each knuckle to the rack bar with FIXED Constraints. Actuation: Set the central hinge on the rack to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity to rotate the rack laterally, translating motion to the knuckles and wheels. Verification: The robot must initiate at (0,0,0) and execute a left turn by rotating the rack, causing the wheels to pivot appropriately within 100 frames.
verification: Robot turns left.

instruction: Task: Construct an articulated steering joint mechanism with motorized rotation. Structure: Create two rectangular structural cubes (size 2x0.5x0.5) representing body segments. Assembly: Position the first segment at (0,0,0.25) and the second segment at (2,0,0.25) so they are aligned end-to-end along the X-axis. Attach the two segments using a Hinge Constraint at the joint point (1,0,0.25) with the hinge axis set to the Z-axis to allow rotational bending. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity of 1.0 rad/s to induce rotation. Verification: The mechanism must start with both segments aligned, and upon actuation, the second segment should rotate relative to the first, achieving a bending angle greater than 20 degrees within 100 frames.
verification: Body bends > 20°

instruction: Task: Construct a robot with crab steering capability. Structure: Create a rectangular chassis platform (size 3x2x0.3) at ground level (Z=0). Add four cylindrical wheels (radius 0.4, depth 0.15) positioned at each corner of the chassis. Assembly: Attach each wheel to the chassis using Hinge Constraints oriented along the vertical Z-axis to enable steering rotation. Actuation: Set all four hinges to MOTOR type with a target velocity that rotates them simultaneously to achieve crab steering (e.g., all wheels turn 45 degrees in the same direction). Verification: The robot must start at position (0,0,0) and move diagonally (e.g., at a 45-degree angle relative to the X-axis) for a distance of at least 10 meters within 200 frames.
verification: Robot moves diagonally.

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized pivot-steering robot. Structure: A central chassis platform (size 3x3x0.5) with two cylindrical wheels (radius 0.5, depth 0.2) attached to the front and rear. Assembly: Attach the front wheel to the platform using a Hinge Constraint along the Y-axis at the front center, allowing it to pivot for steering. Attach the rear wheel to the platform using a Hinge Constraint along the X-axis at the rear center, providing forward/backward motion. Actuation: Set the front hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity to rotate the wheel for steering. Verification: The robot must start at (0,0,0) and perform a turn-in-place rotation greater than 45 degrees within 250 frames, demonstrating effective pivot steering.
verification: Turn-in-place rotation > 45°

instruction: Task: Construct a skid-steering robot with a rectangular chassis and two sets of wheels. Structure: Create a central chassis platform (size 3x2x0.4) at Z=0.4. Add four cylindrical wheels (radius 0.3, depth 0.15) arranged in two pairs on opposite sides of the chassis along the Y-axis. Assembly: Attach the left pair of wheels (front-left and rear-left) to the chassis using FIXED constraints to simulate locked wheels. Attach the right pair of wheels (front-right and rear-right) to the chassis using Hinge Constraints along the X-axis. Actuation: Set both right-side hinges to MOTOR type with differential speeds: left motor at 2.0 and right motor at -2.0 to enable in-place rotation. Verification: The robot must start at (0,0,0.4) and rotate at least 90 degrees clockwise around its Z-axis within 100 frames, demonstrating skid-steering capability.
verification: Robot rotates in place.

instruction: Task: Construct a hinge-based steering axle assembly for a vehicle. Structure: Create a main axle beam (size 2x0.2x0.2) oriented along the X-axis. At each end of the beam, attach a cylindrical wheel (radius 0.3, depth 0.2) using Hinge Constraints aligned vertically (Z-axis). Assembly: Position the axle beam at (0,0,0.5) above ground. Use FIXED constraints to bond the wheels to the axle ends. Actuation: Set both hinges to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity to rotate the wheels, simulating steering action. Action: Rotate the hinges to change the heading direction of the assembly. Verification: The assembly must demonstrate a measurable change in heading direction (e.g., rotation around the Y-axis) when the hinges are activated, confirming steering functionality.
verification: The steering axle assembly must show a clear heading change (rotation around Y-axis) upon hinge activation, verifying steering capability.

instruction: Task: Construct a mechanical assembly with central hinge steering for directional control. Structure: Create a main chassis platform (size 3x1.5x0.4) at the center. Add a front steering arm (size 1.5x0.3x0.3) positioned at the front center of the chassis. Assembly: Attach the steering arm to the chassis using a Hinge Constraint aligned along the Z-axis at the connection point, allowing rotation for steering. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 2.0 to enable rotation. Verification: The assembly must start at (0,0,0) and, upon actuation, the steering arm must rotate to change direction by more than 30 degrees relative to its initial orientation within 100 frames.
verification: Direction change > 30°

instruction: Task: Construct a vehicle with dual-axle steering for tight turning capability. Structure: Create a central rectangular chassis (size 3x1x0.3) positioned at Z=0.3. Add two cylindrical axles: Front axle (size 0.1x0.8x0.1) positioned at (0, 0.4, 0.15) and rear axle (size 0.1x0.8x0.1) positioned at (0, -0.4, 0.15). Attach four cylindrical wheels (radius 0.25, depth 0.15) to the ends of each axle. Assembly: Connect the chassis to both axles using Hinge Constraints along the Z-axis at the center of each axle, allowing rotational steering. Action: Set both hinge constraints to MOTOR type with synchronized rotation to achieve coordinated steering. Verification: The vehicle must demonstrate a tight turning radius of less than 2 meters when executing a full steering maneuver from a stationary position.
verification: The vehicle must demonstrate a tight turning radius of less than 2 meters when executing a full steering maneuver from a stationary position.

instruction: Task: Construct a front articulation steering mechanism for a vehicle. Structure: Create a main chassis platform (size 3x2x0.5) at Z=0.5. Add a front axle assembly consisting of a rectangular steering arm (size 1.5x0.2x0.3) positioned at the front center of the chassis, offset forward by 1.5 meters. Attach two cylindrical wheels (radius 0.4, depth 0.2) to the ends of the steering arm. Assembly: Connect the steering arm to the chassis using a Hinge Constraint aligned along the Z-axis at the pivot point, allowing rotation for steering. Bond the wheels to the steering arm with FIXED Constraints. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity to achieve rotation. Verification: The steering mechanism must rotate the front wheels to achieve a turn angle greater than 25 degrees from the neutral position within the simulation.
verification: Turn angle > 25°

instruction: Task: Construct a steering turret mechanism with a rotating body. Structure: Create a base platform (size 2x2x0.3) positioned on the ground at Z=0. On top of this base, build a turret body (size 1.5x1.5x1.0) centered on the base. Assembly: Connect the turret body to the base using a Hinge Constraint along the vertical Z-axis, allowing rotation around this axis. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity that enables smooth rotation. Verification: The turret body must demonstrate visible orientation changes when the hinge motor is activated, rotating around the Z-axis.
verification: Body orientation changes.

instruction: Task: Construct a mechanical steering joint for a robotic vehicle. Structure: Create a rectangular chassis base (size 2x1x0.3) positioned at (0,0,0.15). Attach a vertical steering column (cylinder radius 0.05, height 0.4) at the front center of the chassis using a FIXED constraint. At the top of the steering column, attach a horizontal steering arm (cube size 0.6x0.1x0.1) using a HINGE constraint aligned along the Z-axis to allow rotation for steering. At each end of the steering arm, attach a vertical wheel assembly consisting of a wheel (cylinder radius 0.25, depth 0.1) connected via a HINGE constraint along the X-axis for rolling. Assembly: Ensure all parts are properly positioned and constrained: FIXED for chassis-to-column, HINGE for column-to-arm (Z-axis rotation), and HINGE for arm-to-wheels (X-axis rotation). Actuation: Set the HINGE constraint between the steering column and arm to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 2.0 to activate steering. Verification: The robot must start at (0,0) and, when the motor is activated, curve its path by at least 30 degrees deviation from a straight line over 100 frames, demonstrating effective steering control.
verification: Robot curves path with at least 30 degrees deviation from straight line over 100 frames when motor is activated.

instruction: Task: Construct a precision steering mechanism for a vehicle. Structure: Create a base platform (size 3x2x0.3) as the vehicle chassis. At the front center of the platform, attach a steering column (cylinder with radius 0.1, height 0.5) using a FIXED constraint. At the top of the steering column, attach a steering wheel (cylinder with radius 0.3, depth 0.05) using a HINGE constraint along the Z-axis. Assembly: Ensure the hinge joint allows rotation around the vertical axis. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 0.0 initially, but program it to rotate precisely to specific angles (e.g., 30°, -45°, 90°) upon command. Verification: The steering wheel must align accurately to a target direction (e.g., marked by a visual target or coordinate) within a tolerance of ±2 degrees, and the system should maintain alignment without drift over 50 frames.
verification: The steering mechanism must rotate the hinge to align the steering wheel precisely with a target direction, achieving alignment within ±2 degrees and maintaining it stably.

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized rover with differential steering for slow, controlled turning. Structure: A central rectangular chassis platform (size 3x1.5x0.4) positioned at Z=0.2. Attach two cylindrical wheels (radius 0.4, depth 0.15) to the left side of the chassis and two identical wheels to the right side, aligned symmetrically along the Y-axis with a 0.8-meter gap between left and right pairs. Assembly: Use Hinge Constraints to attach each wheel to the chassis, with all hinges aligned along the X-axis for rotation. Actuation: Set the left pair of hinges to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 1.5, and the right pair to MOTOR type with a target velocity of -1.5 to create differential steering. Ensure all bonds between chassis and hinges are FIXED. Verification: The rover must start at position (0,0,0.2) and execute a smooth, continuous curved motion along a circular or spiral path over 300 frames, demonstrating controlled turning without abrupt stops or sharp direction changes.
verification: The rover executes a smooth curved motion along a continuous path over 300 frames, demonstrating controlled differential steering without abrupt directional changes.

instruction: Task: Construct a fast-steering vehicle with a differential steering mechanism. Structure: A central chassis platform (size 3x1.5x0.3) made from a cube. Two cylindrical wheels (radius 0.4, depth 0.15) on the left side and two on the right side, each pair attached to a common axle. Axles: Two cylindrical axles (radius 0.05, length 1.8) positioned parallel to the Y-axis, one on the left side and one on the right side, each connecting two wheels. Assembly: Attach the left axle to the chassis at its left side using a Hinge Constraint along the Y-axis. Attach the right axle to the chassis at its right side using a Hinge Constraint along the Y-axis. Attach each wheel to its respective axle using a FIXED Constraint. Actuation: Set both hinge constraints to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 4.0 for forward motion. For sharp turning, program the left motor to run at 4.0 and the right motor to run at -4.0 (or vice versa) to create a differential steering effect. Verification: The vehicle must start at (0,0,0) and execute a sharp 90-degree turn within 50 frames, demonstrating the differential steering capability.
verification: The vehicle performs a sharp 90-degree turn within 50 frames using differential steering with motors set to opposite velocities.

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized vehicle with combined steering and drive capabilities for curved path navigation. Structure: Create a rectangular chassis platform (size 3x1.5x0.4) centered at (0,0,0.2). Add two cylindrical front wheels (radius 0.3, depth 0.15) positioned at the front corners of the chassis, and two cylindrical rear wheels (radius 0.3, depth 0.15) positioned at the rear corners. Assembly: Attach the front wheels to the chassis using Hinge Constraints along the Z-axis to enable steering rotation. Attach the rear wheels to the chassis using Hinge Constraints along the X-axis for forward/backward drive rotation. Use FIXED Constraints to bond all wheels to their respective axles (small cylinders, radius 0.05, depth 0.1) if needed for stability. Actuation: Set the front hinges to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 0.0 initially, but configure them to allow variable steering input (e.g., via keyframes or script) for turning. Set the rear hinges to MOTOR type with a constant target velocity of 2.0 for forward drive. Verification: The vehicle must start at (0,0,0.2) and follow a curved path (e.g., a predefined arc or sinusoidal trajectory) over at least 10 meters in the XY-plane within 300 frames, demonstrating coordinated steering and drive actions.
verification: The vehicle follows a curved path of at least 10 meters in the XY-plane within 300 frames, with front wheels steering and rear wheels driving to achieve the trajectory.

instruction: Task: Construct a crawler vehicle with a steering mechanism. Structure: Create a main chassis platform (size 3x1.5x0.4) at Z=0.4. Add two crawler tracks: each track consists of a front cylindrical wheel (radius 0.3, depth 0.15) and a rear cylindrical wheel (radius 0.3, depth 0.15), connected by a rectangular track belt (size 2x0.1x0.05) that wraps around both wheels. Position the front wheels at the front corners of the chassis and the rear wheels at the rear corners. Assembly: Attach the rear wheels to the chassis using FIXED Constraints to act as drive wheels. For steering, attach the front wheels to the chassis using Hinge Constraints aligned along the Z-axis (vertical axis) to allow rotation for steering. Actuation: Set the Hinge Constraints on the front wheels to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 0.0 initially, but configure them to rotate up to ±30 degrees to simulate steering input. Verification: The crawler must start at position (0,0,0.4) and, upon activating the steering motors, demonstrate a clear direction change by rotating the front wheels and causing the vehicle to turn left or right, observable within 100 frames.
verification: The crawler vehicle must successfully change direction by rotating the front wheels via Hinge Constraints, resulting in a visible turn left or right from its initial straight path.

instruction: Task: Construct an articulated rover with a rotating joint. Structure: Create a primary chassis body (size 3x2x0.5) positioned at (0,0,0.25). Attach a secondary body (size 2x1.5x0.4) to the front of the primary chassis using a Hinge Constraint along the Z-axis, with the joint located at the connection point. Assembly: Bond the primary chassis to the ground with a FIXED constraint at its center to prevent movement. Configure the hinge joint between the two bodies to allow rotation. Actuation: Set the hinge joint to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity sufficient to achieve the verification goal, such as 2.0 rad/s. Verification: The secondary body must rotate relative to the primary chassis, achieving an angle greater than 30 degrees from its initial aligned position within 100 frames.
verification: Body angle > 30°

instruction: Task: Construct a rotating base for a crane steering mechanism. Structure: Create a large, stable base platform (size 5x5x0.8) at ground level (Z=0) using a cube. On top of this base, build a cylindrical turntable (radius 2.0, height 0.5) centered on the platform. Assembly: Bond the base platform to the ground using a FIXED constraint. Connect the turntable to the base platform with a Hinge Constraint along the vertical Z-axis, allowing rotation. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity sufficient to demonstrate rotation (e.g., 1.0 rad/s). Verification: The crane base must start at (0,0,0) and show a clear change in orientation (rotation) of the turntable relative to the fixed base within 100 frames.
verification: Base orientation change

instruction: Task: Construct a simple hinge-turn robot to demonstrate rotational motion. Structure: Create a base platform (size 2x2x0.2) positioned at (0,0,0.1) to serve as the stationary ground anchor. Above this, construct a rotating arm (size 3x0.5x0.2) positioned at (0,0,0.3) to act as the moving part. Assembly: Connect the rotating arm to the base platform using a Hinge Constraint along the Z-axis, with the hinge pivot located at the center of the base (0,0,0.2). Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 2.0 to initiate rotation. Verification: The robot must start with the arm aligned along the X-axis and, upon activation, rotate the arm more than 40 degrees around the Z-axis within 100 frames, as measured from its initial orientation.
verification: The rotating arm must achieve an angular displacement greater than 40 degrees from its starting position along the X-axis.

instruction: Task: Construct a flexible-body steering mechanism for a vehicle. Structure: Create a main chassis platform (size 3x1.5x0.3) at the center. Attach a flexible body component (size 0.5x1.5x0.2) to the front of the chassis using a Hinge Constraint along the Z-axis at the attachment point (local coordinates: front center of chassis). Add a steering linkage (size 0.1x0.8x0.1) connecting the flexible body to a steering actuator (size 0.2x0.2x0.2) positioned at the side. Assembly: Bond the chassis to the ground with a FIXED Constraint at its base. Use Hinge Constraints for all rotational joints: one between chassis and flexible body (steering hinge), and one between linkage and actuator. Actuation: Set the steering hinge to MOTOR type with a target rotation angle that follows a sinusoidal pattern to simulate steering input, causing the flexible body to rotate. Verification: The mechanism must demonstrate an S-curve motion pattern when actuated, with the flexible body smoothly alternating between left and right rotations over time, creating a serpentine path in the X-Y plane.
verification: The flexible body steering mechanism should exhibit a clear S-curve motion, with the flexible body rotating left and right in a controlled, alternating sequence, resulting in a sinusoidal trajectory when observed from above.

instruction: Task: Construct a pivot-base steering mechanism for a vehicle. Structure: Create a base platform (size 3x2x0.3) as the chassis. At the front center of the platform, attach a vertical pivot column (cylinder with radius 0.2, height 0.5) using a FIXED constraint. To the top of this pivot column, attach a steering arm (size 1.5x0.3x0.2) using a HINGE constraint aligned along the Z-axis to allow rotation. Assembly: Ensure the steering arm is positioned horizontally and centered over the pivot column. Actuation: Set the hinge constraint to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity to enable controlled rotation. Verification: The steering arm must rotate in place around the pivot column, demonstrating full 360-degree rotation capability without moving the base platform.
verification: The steering mechanism must rotate the steering arm in place around the pivot column, completing at least one full 360-degree rotation within 100 frames.

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized steering platform. Structure: A rectangular platform (size 3x2x0.3) positioned at Z=0.3 above ground, with a cylindrical steering column (radius 0.1, height 0.5) attached vertically at its center. Assembly: Attach the platform to the steering column using a Hinge Constraint aligned along the Z-axis, allowing rotation. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity of 2.0 radians per second. Verification: The platform must start at (0,0,0.3) and rotate at least 90 degrees around the Z-axis within 100 frames, demonstrating orientation change.
verification: Platform orientation change

instruction: Task: Construct a tracked vehicle with differential steering for turning. Structure: Create a central chassis platform (size 3x1.5x0.4) at Z=0.4. Add two cylindrical track assemblies on each side: each track consists of a front drive wheel (radius 0.3, depth 0.1), a rear idler wheel (radius 0.25, depth 0.1), and a flat track plate (size 2.5x0.6x0.05) positioned between them. Assembly: Attach the front drive wheels to the chassis using Hinge Constraints along the X-axis at positions (-1.25, ±0.75, 0.4). Attach the rear idler wheels similarly at (1.25, ±0.75, 0.4). Connect the track plates to both wheels on each side using FIXED constraints. Actuation: Set the left front hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 2.0, and the right front hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of -2.0 to create differential steering. Verification: The vehicle must start at (0,0,0.4) and execute a turn with a radius of 25° (approximately 0.436 radians) within 150 frames, measured by the change in orientation of the chassis.
verification: The tracked vehicle must achieve a turning radius of 25° (0.436 rad) within 150 frames, starting from position (0,0,0.4).

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized crane base with a steering mechanism. Structure: Create a stationary base platform (size 3x3x0.5) positioned at ground level (Z=0). On top of this, build a rotating crane base (size 2x2x1) centered above the platform. Assembly: Attach the rotating crane base to the stationary platform using a Hinge Constraint aligned along the vertical Z-axis, allowing rotation in the horizontal plane. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity sufficient to demonstrate clear steering rotation. Verification: The crane base must start at a neutral orientation and visibly rotate around the Z-axis, showing a measurable change in orientation over time.
verification: The crane base must start at a neutral orientation and visibly rotate around the Z-axis, showing a measurable change in orientation over time.

instruction: Task: Construct a functional steering linkage mechanism for a vehicle. Structure: Create a main steering arm as a rectangular cube (size 1.5x0.2x0.2) positioned at (0,0,0.5). Add two tie rods as cylindrical rods (radius 0.05, length 1.0) extending from the ends of the steering arm. Connect each tie rod to a steering knuckle at the front wheels using cylindrical joints (radius 0.1, depth 0.1). Assembly: Bond the steering arm to a fixed base (cube size 0.5x0.5x0.5) at Z=0 using a FIXED constraint. Attach each tie rod to the steering arm ends with HINGE constraints along the Z-axis for rotational movement. Connect the opposite ends of the tie rods to the steering knuckles with HINGE constraints along the Y-axis. Actuation: Apply a MOTOR constraint to the central hinge of the steering arm with a target angular velocity of 2.0 rad/s to simulate steering input. Verification: The linkage must demonstrate coordinated turning motion where rotating the steering arm causes both front wheels to turn symmetrically by at least 30 degrees in opposite directions within 100 frames.
verification: The steering linkage mechanism must successfully transmit rotational motion from the central steering arm to both front wheels, resulting in a visible turning action where both wheels pivot symmetrically by a minimum of 30 degrees in opposite directions.

instruction: Task: Construct a hinge-driven rudder system for a robot. Structure: Create a main robot body as a rectangular chassis (size 3x1x0.5) positioned at (0,0,0.25) with its long axis along the Y-axis. Attach a rudder as a vertical rectangular fin (size 0.5x1x0.1) to the rear of the chassis. Assembly: Connect the rudder to the chassis using a Hinge Constraint along the Z-axis, allowing rotation in the XY-plane. Position the hinge at the base of the rudder where it meets the chassis. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 2.0 to activate the motor, causing the rudder to swing. Verification: The robot must start stationary at (0,0,0.25) and, upon motor activation, demonstrate a curved trajectory by moving in a non-linear path, such as an arc or turn, within 100 frames.
verification: Robot curves

instruction: Task: Construct a steering joint system for a vehicle-like mechanism. Structure: Create a main chassis platform (size 3x2x0.5) at Z=0.5 to serve as the base. Add a steering arm (size 0.5x1.5x0.3) positioned at the front center of the chassis, offset by (0, 0.75, 0) from the chassis origin. Assembly: Attach the steering arm to the chassis using a Hinge Constraint along the Z-axis (vertical axis) to allow rotational steering movement. The hinge should be centered at the connection point between the chassis and steering arm. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity that enables controlled rotation. Verification: The steering joint system must demonstrate a direction change greater than 30 degrees when activated, with the steering arm rotating around the Z-axis relative to the chassis, starting from a neutral position and achieving the specified angular displacement within a reasonable timeframe (e.g., 100 frames).
verification: The steering joint system must start at a neutral position and, upon activation, rotate the hinge to achieve a direction change exceeding 30 degrees, as measured by the angular displacement of the steering arm relative to the chassis.

instruction: Task: Construct a rotating crane arm with a motorized hinge. Structure: Create a vertical base column (size 0.5x0.5x4.0) positioned at (0,0,0) on the ground. Attach a horizontal arm (size 4.0x0.5x0.5) to the top of the base column, extending along the X-axis. Assembly: Connect the arm to the base using a HINGE constraint along the Z-axis at the joint point (0,0,4.0). Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 3.0. Action: Rotate the arm around the Z-axis. Verification: The crane arm must start at 0° and rotate at least 90° within 250 frames, measured from the initial position to the final angular displacement.
verification: Arm rotates 90°

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized lifting crane with a rotating hinge mechanism. Structure: A base platform (size 3x3x0.5) at ground level (Z=0). A vertical mast (size 0.5x0.5x6) attached to the center of the base using a FIXED constraint. A horizontal boom (size 6x0.5x0.5) attached to the top of the mast using a HINGE constraint along the Y-axis. A cylindrical counterweight (radius 0.5, depth 1) attached to the boom's near end (closest to mast) using a FIXED constraint. A cylindrical hook object (radius 0.2, depth 0.5) attached to the boom's far end using a FIXED constraint. Assembly: Ensure all parts are properly aligned and bonded as specified. Actuation: Set the hinge at the mast-boom connection to MOTOR type with a target velocity to rotate upward (positive rotation around Y-axis). Verification: The crane must start with the hook at ground level (Z=0) and lift the hook object vertically to a height of at least 5 meters above ground within 250 frames.
verification: Lift object 5m

instruction: Task: Construct a rotating turret crane with a base and a rotating arm. Structure: Create a cylindrical base (radius 1.0, height 2.0) fixed to the ground at Z=0. On top of the base, attach a rectangular arm (size 5.0x0.5x0.5) extending horizontally. Assembly: Bond the base to the ground using a FIXED constraint. Connect the arm to the top of the base using a Hinge Constraint aligned along the Z-axis to allow rotation. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 1.0 to enable smooth rotation. Verification: The crane arm must start at a reference orientation and rotate at least 180 degrees around the Z-axis within 300 frames.
verification: The crane arm must start at a reference orientation and rotate at least 180 degrees around the Z-axis within 300 frames.

instruction: Task: Construct a telescopic crane base with a rotating hinge mechanism. Structure: Build a stationary base platform (size 3x3x0.5) centered at (0,0,0) on the ground. Create a vertical support column (size 0.5x0.5x4) fixed on top of the base platform at its center. At the top of the support column, attach a horizontal boom arm (size 5x0.5x0.5) using a Hinge Constraint along the Z-axis to allow rotation. Assembly: Bond the base platform to the ground with FIXED constraints. Fix the support column vertically to the base platform with FIXED constraints. Connect the boom arm to the top of the support column with a Hinge Constraint aligned to the Z-axis for rotation. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity to enable controlled rotation. Verification: The crane arm must demonstrate a visible change in orientation around the Z-axis when the hinge motor is activated, confirming rotational movement.
verification: Arm orientation change

instruction: Task: Construct a functional crane arm with a payload. Structure: Create a base platform (size 2x2x0.5) at ground level (Z=0). Build a vertical mast (size 0.5x0.5x4) centered on the base. Attach a horizontal arm (size 4x0.5x0.5) to the top of the mast, extending along the X-axis. Add a payload (size 1x1x1) suspended from the end of the arm via a cylindrical connector (radius 0.1, depth 0.2). Assembly: Bond the base to the ground with FIXED constraints. Connect the mast to the base and the arm to the mast using HINGE constraints along the Z-axis for rotation. Attach the payload to the arm with a FIXED constraint via the connector. Actuation: Set the mast-to-arm hinge to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity to rotate the arm horizontally. Verification: The crane must start with the payload at (0,0,4.5) and rotate to move the payload to a position where X > 5 meters within 300 frames.
verification: Move payload to X > 5

instruction: Task: Construct a dual-arm crane with rotational capabilities. Structure: Create a base platform (size 3x3x0.5) at ground level (Z=0). Build two identical arms: each arm consists of a vertical support (size 0.3x0.3x2) attached to the base, a horizontal boom (size 0.2x0.2x4) extending from the top of the support, and a counterweight (size 0.5x0.5x0.5) at the base end of the boom. Assembly: Attach the vertical supports to the base at positions (-1,0,0.5) and (1,0,0.5) using FIXED Constraints. Connect each horizontal boom to its vertical support at the top (Z=2.5) using Hinge Constraints along the Z-axis for rotation. Attach counterweights to the booms at the ends opposite the supports using FIXED Constraints. Action: Set both hinges to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 2.0 to rotate the arms. Verification: The crane arms must start at rest and rotate symmetrically to align forward (parallel to the Y-axis) within 100 frames.
verification: Arms align forward

instruction: Task: Construct a precision crane with a rotating base and an end effector. Structure: 1) Base: A large cylindrical platform (radius 1.5, height 0.3) centered at (0,0,0). 2) Tower: A tall vertical cylinder (radius 0.2, height 4.0) positioned on top of the base at (0,0,0.3). 3) Boom: A horizontal rectangular beam (size 3.0x0.3x0.3) attached to the top of the tower, extending outward. 4) End Effector: A small cube (size 0.2x0.2x0.2) attached to the far end of the boom. Assembly: Bond the tower to the base using a FIXED constraint. Attach the boom to the top of the tower using a HINGE constraint aligned along the vertical Z-axis to allow rotation. Bond the end effector to the boom using a FIXED constraint. Actuation: Set the hinge at the tower-boom connection to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity of 1.0 rad/s to enable controlled rotation. Verification: The crane must start with the end effector at an initial position. Upon actuation, it must rotate such that the end effector reaches a predefined target zone (e.g., a circular area with radius 0.5 centered at (2.5, 2.5, 4.3)) within 100 frames, demonstrating precise rotational movement.
verification: End effector reaches target zone within specified frames.

instruction: Task: Construct a fast-rotating crane with a rotating boom. Structure: 1) Base: A large, stable cube (size 3x3x0.5) centered at (0,0,0) on the ground. 2) Tower: A vertical cylinder (radius 0.3, height 4.0) positioned on top of the base at (0,0,0.5). 3) Boom: A horizontal rectangular cube (size 5x0.5x0.5) attached to the top of the tower, extending outward. Assembly: 1) Bond the base to the ground using a FIXED constraint. 2) Bond the tower to the base using a FIXED constraint at the tower's bottom. 3) Attach the boom to the top of the tower using a HINGE constraint along the vertical Z-axis, allowing rotation in the horizontal plane. Actuation: Set the hinge constraint to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 5.0. Verification: The crane must start with the boom aligned along the positive X-axis and rotate exactly 90 degrees (to align with the positive Y-axis) within 4 seconds (assuming 60 frames per second, so 240 frames).
verification: The crane boom rotates from initial X-axis alignment to 90-degree Y-axis alignment within 240 frames.

instruction: Task: Construct a crane turret with a rotating base. Structure: Create a stationary base platform (size 3x3x0.5) positioned at (0,0,0) on the ground. On top of this, build a rotating turret structure consisting of a vertical support column (size 0.5x0.5x4) centered on the base, and a horizontal boom arm (size 5x0.5x0.5) attached to the top of the column extending outward. Assembly: Bond the base platform to the ground using a FIXED constraint. Connect the turret's vertical column to the base platform using a Hinge Constraint aligned along the Z-axis at the center of the base, allowing rotation. Bond the boom arm to the top of the column with a FIXED constraint. Actuation: Set the hinge connecting the turret to the base to MOTOR type with a target velocity sufficient to achieve a full rotation within a reasonable timeframe (e.g., 2.0 rad/s). Verification: The crane turret must start at rest and complete at least one full 360-degree rotation around the Z-axis within 500 frames, with the base remaining stationary and the turret rotating smoothly.
verification: The crane turret completes at least one full 360-degree rotation around the Z-axis within 500 frames.

instruction: Task: Construct a side crane with a rotating arm. Structure: Build a vertical support column (size 0.5x0.5x4.0) positioned at (0,0,0) on the ground. Attach a horizontal arm (size 6.0x0.3x0.3) to the top of the column, extending along the X-axis. Assembly: Connect the arm to the column using a Hinge Constraint along the Z-axis at the joint point (0,0,4.0). Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity to achieve rotation. Verification: The crane arm must rotate such that its free end reaches an X-coordinate greater than 6.0 meters from the origin within 300 frames.
verification: Arm reaches X > 6

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized lift crane with a rotating arm. Structure: A base platform (size 3x3x0.5) at ground level (Z=0). A vertical support column (size 0.5x0.5x4) fixed atop the base at its center. A horizontal boom arm (size 4x0.3x0.3) attached to the top of the column using a Hinge Constraint along the Y-axis at the joint point. A payload cube (size 0.5x0.5x0.5) attached to the far end of the boom arm using a Fixed Constraint. Assembly: Fix the base to ground. Attach the column to the base with a Fixed Constraint. Connect the boom to the column with a Hinge Constraint at (0,0,4) with rotation axis along Y. Attach the payload to the boom end at (4,0,4). Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity to rotate the boom upward (positive rotation around Y-axis). Verification: The crane must start with the boom horizontal. After actuation, the payload's Z-coordinate (height) must exceed 6 meters above ground.
verification: Payload height > 6 meters above ground (Z-coordinate > 6).

instruction: Task: Construct a rotating platform crane. Structure: A base platform (size 3x3x0.5) at ground level (Z=0) to serve as the foundation. On top of this base, create a vertical support column (size 0.5x0.5x4) centered on the base. At the top of the column, attach a horizontal boom arm (size 4x0.5x0.5) extending outward. At the end of the boom arm, attach a platform (size 2x2x0.2) that will rotate. Assembly: Bond the base platform to the ground using a FIXED constraint. Bond the vertical column to the base platform using a FIXED constraint. Bond the boom arm to the top of the column using a FIXED constraint. Attach the rotating platform to the end of the boom arm using a HINGE constraint along the Z-axis (vertical axis) to allow rotation. Actuation: Set the hinge constraint to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 1.0 rad/s to achieve smooth rotation. Verification: The rotating platform must start at an initial orientation and rotate exactly 90 degrees (π/2 radians) around the Z-axis within 100 frames, as measured from its starting position.
verification: Platform rotates 90°

instruction: Task: Construct a dual-joint crane with a base, arm segments, and an end effector. Structure: 1) Base: A vertical support column (size 0.5x0.5x3.0) positioned at (0,0,0). 2) First Arm Segment: A horizontal beam (size 4.0x0.3x0.3) attached to the top of the base. 3) Second Arm Segment: A horizontal beam (size 3.0x0.3x0.3) attached to the end of the first arm segment. 4) End Effector: A small cube (size 0.2x0.2x0.2) at the tip of the second arm segment. Assembly: Use Hinge Constraints for all joints: a) First Joint: Connect the base to the first arm segment at the top of the base, with the hinge axis along the Z-axis (vertical rotation). b) Second Joint: Connect the first arm segment to the second arm segment at the end of the first arm, with the hinge axis along the Z-axis (vertical rotation). c) Attach the end effector to the second arm segment using a FIXED constraint. Actuation: Set both hinge joints to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 2.0 rad/s each. Position the crane so the base is at (0,0,0) and the arm segments are initially aligned along the positive X-axis. Verification: The crane arm must reach a target point at coordinates (5.0, 2.0, 1.0) within 500 frames by activating the motors to rotate the joints appropriately.
verification: Arm reaches target

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized articulated crane with a base, arm, and boom. Structure: Base platform (size 3x3x0.5) at ground Z=0. Arm (size 0.5x4x0.5) attached vertically to base center. Boom (size 0.5x6x0.5) attached to arm top. Assembly: Attach arm to base using Hinge Constraint along Z-axis (vertical rotation). Attach boom to arm top using Hinge Constraint along Z-axis. Actuation: Set both hinges to MOTOR type with target velocity 2.0 for coordinated rotation. Verification: The crane's end point (boom tip) must start at (0,0,4.5) and move more than 7 meters horizontally from origin within 300 frames.
verification: End point moves > 7m

instruction: Task: Construct a functional crane loader with a rotating hinge mechanism. Structure: Build a base platform (size 3x3x0.5) at ground level (Z=0). On top of this, erect a vertical support column (size 0.5x0.5x4) centered on the platform. Attach a horizontal boom arm (size 4x0.5x0.5) to the top of the column using a Hinge Constraint aligned along the Y-axis, allowing rotation in the X-Z plane. At the free end of the boom, attach a cylindrical load (radius 0.3, height 0.5) using a FIXED constraint. Assembly: Ensure all structural parts are bonded with FIXED constraints except the hinge joint. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity of 2.0 radians per second to enable controlled rotation. Verification: The crane must start with the load at initial position (e.g., near the base), and upon actuation, the hinge rotation must move the load to a new position at least 3 meters away horizontally from its starting point within 100 frames.
verification: Load moved

instruction: Task: Construct a functional crane manipulator with a rotating hinge mechanism. Structure: Create a base platform (size 3x3x0.5) positioned at ground level (Z=0). Build a vertical tower (size 0.5x0.5x4) centered on the base. Attach a horizontal boom (size 4x0.5x0.5) to the top of the tower using a Hinge Constraint along the Z-axis. Add a cylindrical counterweight (radius 0.3, depth 0.5) at the boom's base end and a cubic hook (size 0.3x0.3x0.5) at the boom's far end. Assembly: Use FIXED constraints to bond the base to ground, tower to base, counterweight to boom, and hook to boom. Apply a Hinge Constraint between the tower top and boom for rotation. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 2.0 to enable controlled rotation. Verification: The crane must start with the boom aligned along the X-axis, rotate the hinge to reposition the hook at least 90 degrees, and demonstrate the hook's movement from its initial position to a new location, confirming object repositioning.
verification: The crane manipulator's hook must be repositioned by rotating the hinge at least 90 degrees, with visible movement from its starting point to a new position within 100 frames.

instruction: Task: Construct a precision crane with a rotating boom. Structure: Create a sturdy base platform (size 3x3x0.5) centered at (0,0,0). Build a vertical mast (size 0.5x0.5x4) positioned at the center of the base. Attach a horizontal boom (size 5x0.3x0.3) to the top of the mast, extending outward. Assembly: Bond the base to the ground using FIXED constraints. Connect the mast to the base with a FIXED constraint. Attach the boom to the mast using a Hinge Constraint aligned along the Z-axis (vertical rotation axis) at the connection point. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity to achieve controlled rotation. Verification: The crane must start with the boom pointing along the positive X-axis. Activate the motor to rotate the boom and align its tip within 0.5 meters of a target point located at (4,3,0) within 300 frames.
verification: Align the tip of the crane boom within 0.5 meters of the target point (4,3,0) through controlled rotation.

instruction: Task: Construct a functional cargo crane with a rotating mechanism to transport a payload. Structure: Build a base platform (size 3x3x0.5) at ground level (Z=0). Erect a vertical mast (size 0.5x0.5x4) centered on the base. Attach a horizontal boom (size 4x0.5x0.5) to the top of the mast, extending outward. At the end of the boom, create a payload (size 1x1x1) suspended by a cable (represented as a thin cylinder, radius 0.05, length 2). Assembly: Fix the base to the ground with FIXED constraints. Connect the mast to the base and the boom to the mast using HINGE constraints along the Z-axis for rotation. Attach the cable to the boom with a FIXED constraint and the payload to the cable with a HINGE constraint for potential swinging. Actuation: Set the mast-boom HINGE to MOTOR type with a target velocity to achieve a controlled rotation. Verification: The crane must start with the payload at an initial position, rotate to transport the payload a horizontal distance of at least 6 meters, and ensure the payload is lifted and moved without detachment, all within 300 frames.
verification: Payload transported 6m horizontally from start to end position.

instruction: Task: Construct a crane turntable mechanism. Structure: Create a base platform (size 3x3x0.5) at ground level (Z=0). On top of this, build a rotating platform (size 2x2x0.3) centered above the base. Assembly: Connect the rotating platform to the base using a Hinge Constraint along the Z-axis (vertical axis) at the center point (0,0,0.5). Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity sufficient to achieve smooth rotation. Verification: The rotating platform must start at its initial orientation and complete a full 180-degree rotation around the Z-axis within a specified timeframe (e.g., 250 frames).
verification: The crane turntable must rotate exactly 180 degrees around the vertical axis.

instruction: Task: Construct a rotating arm loader mechanism. Structure: Create a base platform (size 3x3x0.5) positioned at ground level (Z=0). On this base, build a vertical support column (size 0.5x0.5x2) centered on the platform. At the top of the column, attach a horizontal rotating arm (size 4x0.5x0.5) using a Hinge Constraint along the Z-axis to allow rotation. At the far end of the arm, attach a lifting mechanism: a vertical grabber arm (size 0.5x0.5x1.5) with a fixed cube (size 0.8x0.8x0.3) at its bottom to serve as a lifting platform. Use FIXED constraints to bond all structural components except the rotating joint. Actuation: Set the hinge at the base of the rotating arm to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity sufficient to complete a 90-degree rotation within 100 frames. Verification: The loader must start with the arm extended horizontally, rotate to pick up a test object (e.g., a cube of size 0.5x0.5x0.5 placed at coordinates (2,0,0.5)), lift it by at least 1 meter vertically, and move it to a new position (e.g., (0,2,1.5)) within 300 frames.
verification: The rotating arm loader successfully lifts the test object from its initial position and moves it to the target location, demonstrating both rotation and lifting capabilities.

instruction: Task: Construct a crane tower with a rotating arm. Structure: Build a vertical tower base (size 1x1x10) centered at (0,0,0) on the ground. Attach a horizontal arm (size 8x0.5x0.5) to the top of the tower at (0,0,10) using a Hinge Constraint aligned along the Z-axis, allowing rotation in the XY plane. Assembly: Ensure the arm is positioned such that it extends horizontally from the tower. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity to achieve a smooth rotation. Verification: The crane arm must start at a reference position and sweep an arc greater than 120 degrees around the tower within 300 frames.
verification: The crane arm must rotate more than 120 degrees around the Z-axis from its starting position, measured by the change in angle of the arm relative to the tower, within the simulation timeframe.

instruction: Task: Construct a crane swing arm mechanism. Structure: Create a vertical support tower (size 1x1x6) fixed to ground at (0,0,0). Build a horizontal swing arm (size 8x0.5x0.5) attached to the top of the tower. Assembly: Connect the swing arm to the tower using a Hinge Constraint at the tower's top center (0,0,6) with rotation axis along Z-axis. Add a payload cube (size 1x1x1) suspended from the swing arm's far end via a FIXED constraint. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity of 2.0 rad/s to rotate the arm. Verification: The payload must start at rest and move laterally at least 5 meters horizontally from its initial position within 100 frames.
verification: Payload moves laterally 5m

instruction: Task: Construct a crane manipulator with a rotating base and an articulated arm. Structure: Base (size 2x2x0.5) at ground level Z=0. Vertical mast (size 0.5x0.5x4) attached to base center. Horizontal boom (size 4x0.5x0.5) attached to mast top. End effector (size 0.5x0.5x0.5) at boom end. Assembly: Attach mast to base with Hinge Constraint along Z-axis for rotation. Attach boom to mast with Hinge Constraint along Y-axis for vertical articulation. Attach end effector to boom with FIXED Constraint. Actuation: Set base hinge to MOTOR type with target velocity 2.0 for rotation. Verification: The end effector must start at initial position and rotate to reach a target point at coordinates (3, 3, 3) within 200 frames.
verification: End effector reaches target

instruction: Task: Construct a rotating boom crane with a fixed base and a rotating arm. Structure: Create a fixed base cube (size 2x2x0.5) centered at (0,0,0) on the ground. Build a boom arm as a long rectangular cube (size 0.3x6x0.3) positioned vertically at one end, with its bottom end at (0,0,0.5) and extending upward. Assembly: Attach the boom arm to the base using a Hinge Constraint along the Z-axis at the connection point (0,0,0.5). Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 1.0 to enable smooth rotation. Verification: The boom arm must start at its initial position and rotate at least 90 degrees around the Z-axis within 100 frames, demonstrating full rotational capability.
verification: Boom rotates 90°

instruction: Task: Construct a crane grabber mechanism. Structure: Create a base platform (size 2x2x0.5) at ground level (Z=0). Build a vertical support column (size 0.3x0.3x3) attached to the base center using a FIXED constraint. Add a horizontal boom (size 3x0.3x0.3) extending from the top of the column, attached with a HINGE constraint along the Z-axis at the joint. At the end of the boom, attach a grabber assembly consisting of two opposing claw arms (each size 0.8x0.2x0.2) connected by a HINGE constraint along the Y-axis to allow opening/closing. Assembly: Ensure all structural connections use FIXED constraints. Actuation: Set the boom-to-column hinge to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity of 2.0 radians per second to enable rotation. Verification: The crane grabber must start with the boom at 0 degrees, rotate the hinge to reposition an object (e.g., a cube of size 0.5x0.5x0.5 placed at (2,0,1)) by at least 3 meters horizontally within 150 frames.
verification: Object repositioned

instruction: Task: Construct a heavy-duty crane arm capable of rotational movement. Structure: Build a sturdy base platform (size 3x3x0.5) at ground level (Z=0). Extend a vertical support column (size 0.5x0.5x4) from the center of the base. Attach a horizontal arm (size 6x0.5x0.5) to the top of the column using a Hinge Constraint along the Z-axis for rotation. Add a counterweight block (size 1x1x1) at the rear end of the arm and a hook block (size 0.3x0.3x0.5) at the front end. Assembly: Use FIXED constraints to bond the base to ground, column to base, counterweight to arm, and hook to arm. Use a Hinge Constraint between the column top and arm center for rotation, set to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 2.0 for smooth action. Verification: The crane arm must rotate at least 90 degrees and lift the hook block to a height greater than 4 meters above ground within 200 frames.
verification: Lift > 4m

instruction: Task: Construct a crane rotator mechanism. Structure: A base platform (size 3x3x0.5) positioned at ground level (Z=0). A vertical support column (cylinder radius 0.3, height 4.0) fixed atop the base center. A rotating arm (size 4x0.5x0.5) attached to the top of the column via a Hinge Constraint aligned with the Z-axis. Assembly: Use FIXED constraint to bond the base to ground and the column to the base. Attach the rotating arm to the column top with a Hinge Constraint at the connection point, allowing rotation around the Z-axis. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity sufficient to achieve a full rotation within the simulation timeframe. Verification: The rotating arm must complete a full 360° rotation around the Z-axis within 250 frames, starting from its initial position.
verification: The crane rotator's arm completes a full 360° rotation around the Z-axis within the simulation timeframe.

instruction: Task: Construct a rotating crane platform. Structure: A base platform (size 5x5x0.5) positioned on the ground at Z=0. A rotating platform (size 3x3x0.3) placed on top of the base platform, centered. Assembly: Attach the rotating platform to the base platform using a Hinge Constraint along the Z-axis at the center point. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 2.0 to enable rotation. Verification: The rotating platform must start at (0,0,0.5) and demonstrate visible rotation around the Z-axis within 100 frames.
verification: Platform rotates.

instruction: Task: Construct a motorized crane carrier with a rotating arm to move a payload. Structure: Build a rectangular base platform (size 3x2x0.5) as the carrier body. At the center of the platform, attach a vertical cylindrical column (radius 0.2, height 2.0) using a FIXED constraint. At the top of the column, attach a horizontal cylindrical arm (radius 0.15, length 4.0) using a HINGE constraint along the vertical Z-axis to allow rotation. At the end of the arm, attach a cubic payload (size 0.5x0.5x0.5) using a FIXED constraint. Ensure all parts are positioned with the base platform's bottom at Z=0. Assembly: Use FIXED constraints for all structural bonds (base to column, arm to payload) and a HINGE constraint at the column-arm junction. Actuation: Set the HINGE constraint to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity to achieve rotation, aiming for a smooth motion to move the payload. Verification: The crane carrier must start with the payload at an initial position, and upon actuation, rotate the arm to move the payload a total displacement of 8 meters in the horizontal plane (X-Y) within 300 frames.
verification: Payload moved 8m

instruction: Task: Construct a rotating crane base. Structure: Create a stationary ground platform (size 10x10x1) positioned at Z=0. Build a cylindrical crane base tower (radius 2, height 6) centered on the platform. Assembly: Bond the crane base tower to the ground platform using a FIXED Constraint at the bottom. Create a Hinge Constraint at the top of the crane base tower (Z=6) with rotation axis along the vertical Z-axis. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity sufficient to demonstrate rotation. Verification: The crane base must start at orientation (0,0,0) and show measurable orientation change (e.g., at least 90 degrees rotation) within 100 frames.
verification: The crane base must start at orientation (0,0,0) and show measurable orientation change (e.g., at least 90 degrees rotation) within 100 frames.

instruction: Task: Construct a rotating lift arm mechanism. Structure: A base platform (size 2x2x0.5) positioned at ground level (Z=0). A vertical support column (size 0.2x0.2x3) attached centrally on top of the base. A lift arm (size 3x0.5x0.3) attached to the top of the support column. Assembly: Bond the base to the ground using a FIXED Constraint. Attach the support column to the base with a FIXED Constraint. Connect the lift arm to the top of the support column using a Hinge Constraint aligned along the Y-axis, allowing rotation in the vertical plane. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target angular velocity sufficient to achieve the required height. Verification: The lift arm must rotate from a horizontal starting position to achieve a vertical height greater than 6 meters at its endpoint within 200 frames.
verification: Height > 6

instruction: Task: Construct a crane swivel mechanism. Structure: Create a base platform (size 3x3x0.5) at ground level (Z=0). On top of this, build a vertical support column (size 0.5x0.5x4) centered on the platform. At the top of the column, attach a horizontal crane arm (size 4x0.3x0.3) extending outward. Assembly: Connect the crane arm to the top of the support column using a Hinge Constraint along the Z-axis to allow rotation. Actuation: Set the hinge to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 2.0 to enable controlled rotation. Verification: The crane arm must start at its initial position and rotate exactly 120 degrees around the Z-axis within 100 frames.
verification: Arm rotates 120°

instruction: Task: Construct a multi-joint crane with an end effector. Structure: Build a base platform (size 3x3x0.5) at ground level (Z=0). Attach a vertical column (size 0.5x0.5x4) to the center of the base using a FIXED constraint. At the top of the column, attach a horizontal boom (size 4x0.5x0.5) using a HINGE constraint along the Z-axis for rotation. At the end of the boom, attach a vertical arm (size 0.3x0.3x2) using a HINGE constraint along the X-axis for tilting. At the bottom of the vertical arm, attach the end effector as a small cube (size 0.2x0.2x0.2) using a FIXED constraint. Actuation: Set all HINGE constraints to MOTOR type with a target velocity of 2.0. Action: Activate all motors simultaneously to coordinate movement. Verification: The end effector must start at its initial position and reach a target coordinate of (5, 3, 2) within 300 frames, ensuring smooth joint operation.
verification: End effector reaches target coordinate (5, 3, 2) within 300 frames.
